analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar sngar mthong bas @326b phyis the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes bgyi ba kha cig ni dngos po rnam pa gnyis ma mthong bar the tshom du 'gyur ba'ang ma mchis so //

analyzed: gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: World-Honored One,

analyzed: sngon ma mthong na ci'i slad du the tshom skye; bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bcad pa'o //

analyzed: dar ba dang / skye ba dang / shi ba dang / bcings pa dang / grol ba dang / mdza' ba sdug pa dang bral ba dang / dgra sdang ba dang phrad ba ste /

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: mi des sngon zab pa dang mi zab pa'i gnas mthong ba'i tshe'ang the tshom ma skyes na /

analyzed: de ci'i slad du the tshom skye bar 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Buddha said, “Good son,

analyzed: sngon ma phyin pa'i phyir the tshom skyes par 'gyur te /
translated: because he has never been there before, he becomes doubtful.

analyzed: de bas na ma rtogs pa la the tshom skye'o zhes ngas gsungs so //

analyzed: chags pa nyid the tshom lags na de gang la bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Buddha said, “Good son,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa la bya'o //
translated: It refers to those who have severed their roots of virtue.

original: 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: Kāśyapa asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: gang dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'gyur /

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gang shes rab gsal zhing dbang po rno ba /
translated: “Son of noble family,🔽those who abandon the spiritual friend who has clear wisdom and sharp faculties,

translated: Moreover, they think, “Giving, receiving, and material things are impermanent.

analyzed: mi sdod mi gnas so //

original: de ltar mi sdod mi gnas na /
analyzed: de ltar mi sdod mi gnas na /

analyzed: ji ste 'di ni sbyin pa /

analyzed: yang 'di snyam du sbyin pa byin pa na dngos po rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: “ ‘Moreover, they think, “When giving a gift, there are five things:🔽the giver, the recipient, the thing given, the act of giving, and the result of the act of giving.

analyzed: len pa des blangs nas dge ba byed dam mi dge ba byed na'ang /

analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi chos kyang sa bon las 'bras bu skye ste /

translated: and the result is the recipient.

analyzed: de ltar len pa des dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos kyis sbyin bdag thob par byed mi nus te /

analyzed: don de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu med do //

original: @328a *// snyam sems so //
analyzed: @328a *// snyam sems so //

analyzed: gang de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu med par smra ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who speak in this way about the absence of cause and effect should be known as those who sever the roots of virtue.

original: yang 'di snyam du sbyin pa'i rdzas de ni med pa'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du sbyin pa'i rdzas de ni med pa'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: They will also think, “The substance of the gift does not exist. And why is that?

analyzed: sbyin pa'i rdzas ni lung du mi ston pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar lung du mi ston pa yin na dge ba'i 'bras bu ji ltar rnam par smin par 'gyur /

analyzed: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu med pa ni lung du mi ston pa yin no //

original: de ltar rdzas lung du mi ston pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar rdzas lung du mi ston pa yin pas na /
translated: Since it is a substance that is indeterminate,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med par rig go /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med par rig go /
translated: it is known to be neither the result of virtue nor of nonvirtue.

original: de bas na sbyin pa'ang med; rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang med do snyam sems so //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa'ang med; rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang med do snyam sems so //
translated: Thus, they think that there is no giving, and that there is no cause and effect.”

original: gang de ltar bsams nas rgyu dang 'bras bu med par smra ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o ////
analyzed: gang de ltar bsams nas rgyu dang 'bras bu med par smra ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o ////
translated: “Those who think in this way and speak of the nonexistence of cause and effect are to be known as those who sever the roots of virtue.”

original: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: Noble Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra

original: bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi bcu drug pa /

original: yang 'di snyam du sbyin pa ni yid yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du sbyin pa ni yid yin te /

analyzed: gal te yid yin na mi mthong zhing zla med pas gzugs kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: If it is mental, it is not a visible phenomenon, since it is not seen and has no counterpart.’

analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi chos ma yin na sbyin pa byar yang ci zhig yod de /
translated: If there is no form, what is there to give?

original: de bas na sbyin pa'ang med /
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa'ang med /
translated: Therefore, there is no giving,

original: rgyu'ang med / 'bras bu'ang med do //🔽gang de ltar rgyu'ang med /
analyzed: rgyu'ang med / 'bras bu'ang med do // gang de ltar rgyu'ang med /
translated: no cause, and no effect.🔽One who speaks in this way,

analyzed: 'bras bu'ang med par smra na de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: who says that there is no cause and no effect, should be known as someone who cuts off the roots of virtue.

original: yang 'di snyam du sbyin bdag gis gal te sangs rgyas kyi gzugs sam /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du sbyin bdag gis gal te sangs rgyas kyi gzugs sam /
translated: Moreover, one might think, “If a donor gives to the form of a buddha,

analyzed: lha'i @328b gzugs sam /
translated: to the form of a god,

original: tshe'i tshad dam /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad dam /
translated: to the length of life,

analyzed: pha ma 'das pa'i phyir sbyin pa byed na len pa med do //
translated: to a mother, or to a father, there is no recipient.

analyzed: gal te len pa med na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'ang med pa'i rigs so //
translated: If there is no recipient, it is reasonable that there is no karmic maturation of the effect.

original: gal te 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med na rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med na rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no karmic maturation of the effect, there is no cause.

original: gal te rgyu med na 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro snyam sems te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med na 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro snyam sems te /
translated: If there is no cause, there is no effect.”

analyzed: gang de ltar bsams nas rgyu dang 'bras bu med par smra ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa yin bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One who thinks in this way and denies cause and effect is cutting off the roots of virtue.

original: yang 'di snyam du pha med /
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du pha med /
translated: “Again, one may think, ‘There is no father,

original: ma'ang med do //
analyzed: ma'ang med do //

analyzed: ji ste pha ma gnyis sems can gyi rgyu yin la /
translated: If the father and mother are the cause of sentient beings,

analyzed: sems can skyes so zhes smra na tshul gyis rgyun mi 'chad par rtag tu skye ba'i rigs so; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rgyu ni rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar rtag tu mi skye ste /

analyzed: de bas na pha ma ni med pa yin par rig go snyam sems so //

analyzed: yang 'di snyam du gal te 'phags pa thams cad la mya ngan las 'das pa gcig pu zhig yid na 'phags @331b pa med par rig go /
translated: Moreover, he thinks: If there were only one nirvāṇa for all noble ones, we would know that there are no noble ones.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not apprehended.

original: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni chos nyid kyis dmigs su med pa la blang dor med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni chos nyid kyis dmigs su med pa la blang dor med pa'o //
translated: A permanent phenomenon is not apprehended by the nature of phenomena, and it is neither accepted nor rejected.

original: gal te 'phags pa rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba mang na mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba mang na mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were many nirvāṇas, then nirvāṇa would be impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be perceptible.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gcig tu zad na mi gcig gis thob pa'i tshe thams cad kyis thob pa'i rigs so; ;gal te mya ngan las 'das pa mang ba zhig yin na mtha' dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gcig tu zad na mi gcig gis thob pa'i tshe thams cad kyis thob pa'i rigs so; ;gal te mya ngan las 'das pa mang ba zhig yin na mtha' dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were only one nirvāṇa, then when one person attained nirvāṇa, it would be logical that everyone would attain it. If there were many nirvāṇas, then nirvāṇa would have an end.

original: ji ste mtha' dang bcas pa zhig yin na rtag pa'o zhes ji ltar gdags /
analyzed: ji ste mtha' dang bcas pa zhig yin na rtag pa'o zhes ji ltar gdags /
translated: If it had an end, then how could it be said to be permanent?

original: gal te la las 'di skad du mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gcig ste /
analyzed: gal te la las 'di skad du mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gcig ste /
translated: If someone were to say, ‘The nature of nirvāṇa is one,

original: rnam par grol ba ni mang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni mang ngo //
translated: but there are many liberations.

original: dper na / gdugs gcig la khye'u so mang ba dang 'dra'o zhes smra na /
analyzed: dper na / gdugs gcig la khye'u so mang ba dang 'dra'o zhes smra na /
translated: It is like many children being born under one sun.’

original: don de'ang de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: don de'ang de lta ma yin no //
translated: That meaning is not so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; so so nas thob kyi thams cad kyis thob pa ma yin pas mtha' dang bcas pa'i phyir de'ang mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; so so nas thob kyi thams cad kyis thob pa ma yin pas mtha' dang bcas pa'i phyir de'ang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Why is that? Because it is attained individually, not by everyone, and therefore it has an end. It is impermanent.

original: gal te mi rtag na ji ste mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag na ji ste mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
translated: If it is impermanent, why is it called nirvana?

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa med na su zhig 'phags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa med na su zhig 'phags par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no nirvana, who is an ārya?

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa med par rig go snyam sems so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa med par rig go snyam sems so //
translated: Therefore, we know that āryas do not exist.”

original: yang 'di snyam du 'phags pa'i lam ni rten 'brel te 'byung ba las thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du 'phags pa'i lam ni rten 'brel te 'byung ba las thob pa ma yin no //
translated: “Moreover, the ārya path is dependent origination, not attained from arising.

original: ji ste 'phags pa'i lam rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas thob pa yin na ci'i phyir thams cad 'phags par ma gyur /
analyzed: ji ste 'phags pa'i lam rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas thob pa yin na ci'i phyir thams cad 'phags par ma gyur /
translated: If the ārya path is attained from dependent origination, why are not all beings āryas?

original: gal te thams cad 'phags pa ma yin na @332a *//
analyzed: gal te thams cad 'phags pa ma yin na @332a *//
translated: If all are not āryas,

original: 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam med par rig go snyam sems so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam med par rig go snyam sems so //
translated: we know that āryas and the ārya path do not exist.”

original: yang 'di snyam du 'phags pa'i lam gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba la rgyu rkyen gnyis yod do //
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du 'phags pa'i lam gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba la rgyu rkyen gnyis yod do //
translated: “Moreover, the right view of the ārya path has two causes and conditions.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gzhan las chos thos pa dang / rang gis nang du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las chos thos pa dang / rang gis nang du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Hearing the Dharma from another and internally attending to it oneself.

original: gal te rgyu rkyen de gnyis rkyen las skyes na rkyen las skye ba de nyid kyang rkyen las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu rkyen de gnyis rkyen las skyes na rkyen las skye ba de nyid kyang rkyen las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If these two causes and conditions arise from conditions, then that arising from conditions would itself arise from conditions.

original: de ltar gcig gis gcig bskyed pas mthar thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gcig gis gcig bskyed pas mthar thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, since one would be generating the other, there would be the fault of an infinite regress.

original: gal te dngos po de gnyis rkyen las ma skyes na sems can thams cad kyis ji ste ma thob snyam sems te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po de gnyis rkyen las ma skyes na sems can thams cad kyis ji ste ma thob snyam sems te /
translated: If these two things do not arise from conditions, why is it that all sentient beings do not obtain them?

original: gang de ltar rtog pa de'i tshe na dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de ltar rtog pa de'i tshe na dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one thinks in this way, one severs the roots of virtue.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gal te sems can gang zhig gis de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu med par shin tu lta na gang zag des ni dad pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba lnga gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems can gang zhig gis de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu med par shin tu lta na gang zag des ni dad pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba lnga gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: if any sentient being were to view in this way that there are no causes and effects, that person would sever the five roots of virtue, such as faith.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni dma' ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa ni dma' ba /
translated: the roots of virtue are not severed by those who are lowly,

original: zhan pa / dbang po rtul zhing rmongs pas ma yin /
analyzed: zhan pa / dbang po rtul zhing rmongs pas ma yin /
translated: weak, or dull-witted and ignorant.

original: lha dang / ngan song gsum du skyes pas gcod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lha dang / ngan song gsum du skyes pas gcod pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not severed by those born as gods or in the three lower realms.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha is also like this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa asked:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: gang zag de nam zhig gi dus na dge ba'i rtsa ba slar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zag de nam zhig gi dus na dge ba'i rtsa ba slar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: when will the wholesome roots of that person grow again?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: gang zag des dus gnyis kyi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag des dus gnyis kyi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: there are two times when the wholesome roots of that person will grow:

original: thog ma sems @332b can dmyal bar ltung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba las byung ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: thog ma sems @332b can dmyal bar ltung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba las byung ba'i tshe'o //
translated: when they first fall into the hells and when they emerge from the hells.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dge ba la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: wholesomeness is of three kinds:

original: 'das pa dang / da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: past, present, and future.

original: de la 'das pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'gags pas rgyu 'gags te zad mod kyi /
analyzed: de la 'das pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'gags pas rgyu 'gags te zad mod kyi /
translated: Among them, the past is naturally ceased, and the cause has ceased and is exhausted.

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ma smin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ma smin te /
translated: However, the ripened result has not yet ripened.

original: de bas na 'das pa'i 'bras bu bcad pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa'i 'bras bu bcad pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the past result is not called ‘cut off.’

original: dus gsum gyi rgyu bcad pa ni bcad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi rgyu bcad pa ni bcad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Cutting off the cause of the three times is called ‘cut off.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Bodhisattva Light Keeper said to the Buddha:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “World-Honored One,

original: gal te dus gsum gyi rgyu bcad pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: gal te dus gsum gyi rgyu bcad pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: if the severing of the roots of goodness is called the severing of the causal basis of the three periods of time,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa de nyid la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin de 'das pa lags sam /🔽da ltar lags sam /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa de nyid la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin de 'das pa lags sam / da ltar lags sam /
translated: if the severed roots of goodness still have buddha-nature, is this buddha-nature past,

original: ma 'ongs pa lags sam /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa lags sam /
translated: present, or future?

original: 'on te dus gsum kun tu khyab pa lags /
analyzed: 'on te dus gsum kun tu khyab pa lags /
translated: Or does it pervade all three periods of time?

original: gal te 'das pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa lags na /
translated: If it is past,

original: ji ltar rtag pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa zhes bgyi /
translated: how can it be called eternal?

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: Buddha-nature is eternal,

original: de bas na 'das pa ma lags so; ;'on te ma 'ongs pa lags na ji ltar rtag par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa ma lags so; ;'on te ma 'ongs pa lags na ji ltar rtag par 'gyur /
translated: so it is not past. If it is future, how can it be eternal?

original: ji ste bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can thams cad kyis gdon mi za bar thob bo zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ji ste bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can thams cad kyis gdon mi za bar thob bo zhes gsungs /
translated: If the World-Honored One says that all sentient beings will certainly attain it,

original: gal te gdon mi za bar thob na ci'i slad du bcad pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gal te gdon mi za bar thob na ci'i slad du bcad pa zhes bgyi /
translated: if they will certainly attain it, why speak of severing it?

original: 'on te da ltar gyi lags na /
analyzed: 'on te da ltar gyi lags na /
translated: If it is the present,

original: yang ji ltar rtag pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rtag pa zhes bgyi /
translated: how can it be called permanent?

original: yang ci'i slad du gdon mi za bar mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs /🔽de bzhin gshegs @333a *//
analyzed: yang ci'i slad du gdon mi za bar mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs / de bzhin gshegs @333a *//
translated: Why did you say that it must be seen?

original: pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la'ang rnam pa drug mchis par gsungs te /
analyzed: pas sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la'ang rnam pa drug mchis par gsungs te /
translated: The Tathāgata has also said that the buddha-nature has six aspects:

original: rtag pa dang / yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / dge ba dang / rnam par dag pa dang / bltar rung ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / dge ba dang / rnam par dag pa dang / bltar rung ba'o //
translated: permanence, reality, truth, virtue, purity, and visibility.

original: gal te dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If those who have severed the roots of virtue have buddha-nature, it is not correct to say that they have severed the roots of virtue.

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma mchis na ci'i slad du sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis zhes gsungs /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma mchis na ci'i slad du sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis zhes gsungs /
translated: If they do not have buddha-nature, why did you say that all sentient beings have buddha-nature?

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis pa'ang lags la /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis pa'ang lags la /
translated: If they have buddha-nature

original: gcad du'ang rung na ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rtag go zhes gsungs /
analyzed: gcad du'ang rung na ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rtag go zhes gsungs /
translated: and can sever it, why did the Bhagavat say that it is permanent?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of good family,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sems can gyi phyir 'dri ba'i lan btab pa la rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sems can gyi phyir 'dri ba'i lan btab pa la rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: the Bhagavat Buddha has four kinds of answers to questions for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?🔽They are: definite answers,

original: nges par lan btab pa dang / rnam par phye ste lan btab pa dang / ji ltar dris pa de ltar lan btab pa dang / bzhag nas lan mi 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par lan btab pa dang / rnam par phye ste lan btab pa dang / ji ltar dris pa de ltar lan btab pa dang / bzhag nas lan mi 'debs pa'o //
translated: answers that distinguish, answers that ask for further questioning, and answers that set aside.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: de la ji ltar na nges par lan btab pa zhe na /🔽gal te las ngan pa byed pas dge ba'i 'bras bu thob bam /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na nges par lan btab pa zhe na / gal te las ngan pa byed pas dge ba'i 'bras bu thob bam /
translated: what is a definite answer?

original: mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob ces 'dri na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob ces 'dri na /
translated: If someone asks, ‘Do those who do bad actions obtain a virtuous result or an unvirtuous result?’🔽and so on,

original: de la ni nges par mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob bo zhes lan 'debs te /
analyzed: de la ni nges par mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob bo zhes lan 'debs te /
translated: then the answer is definite: ‘They obtain an unvirtuous result.’

original: dge ba'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to virtue.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mnga' ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mnga' ba yin nam /
translated: If someone asks, ‘Does the Tathāgata have the knowledge of omniscience

original: ma yin zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: ma yin zhes 'dri na /
translated: or not?’

original: de la ni nges par thams cad @333b mkhyen pa yin no /🔽zhes lan 'debs so //
analyzed: de la ni nges par thams cad @333b mkhyen pa yin no /🔽zhes lan 'debs so //
translated: then the answer is definite: ‘He has omniscience.’

original: gal te gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa yin nam zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa yin nam zhes 'dri na /
translated: If someone asks, “Are the qualities of the Buddha pure?”

original: de la ni nges par rnam par dag pa yin no zhes lan 'debs so //
analyzed: de la ni nges par rnam par dag pa yin no zhes lan 'debs so //
translated: you should answer, “They are definitely pure.”

original: gal te gang gis sangs rgyas kyi nye gnas rnams chos bzhin du gnas pa yin nam zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis sangs rgyas kyi nye gnas rnams chos bzhin du gnas pa yin nam zhes 'dri na /
translated: If someone asks, “Do the disciples of the Buddha live according to the Dharma?”🔽you should answer, “They definitely live according to the Dharma.”

original: de la ni nges par chos bzhin du gnas pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa de ni nges par lan btab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ni nges par chos bzhin du gnas pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa de ni nges par lan btab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a definite answer.

original: rnam par phye nas lan btab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par phye nas lan btab pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a differentiated answer?

original: ji ltar ngas bden pa bzhi gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ngas bden pa bzhi gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is like the way I teach the four noble truths.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
translated: They are the noble truths of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the noble truth of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad yod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad yod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because there are eight kinds of suffering, it is called the noble truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the noble truth of the origin of suffering?

original: lnga phung gi rgyu yod pa'i phyir kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lnga phung gi rgyu yod pa'i phyir kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the cause of the five aggregates exists, it is called the truth of the arising of suffering.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of cessation?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug mthar ma lus par bgags pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug mthar ma lus par bgags pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The complete cessation of desire, hatred, and ignorance is called the truth of cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na; byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni lam gyi bden pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye nas lan btab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa gang zhe na; byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni lam gyi bden pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye nas lan btab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the truth of the path? The thirty-seven factors of awakening are called the truth of the path. This is called the answer that distinguishes.

original: de la ji ltar na dris pa de ltar lan btab pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na dris pa de ltar lan btab pa zhe na /
translated: What is the answer that is like the question?

original: ji ltar ngas chos thams cad mi rtag go zhes bshad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar ngas chos thams cad mi rtag go zhes bshad pa bzhin te /
translated: Just as I have explained that all phenomena are impermanent,

original: yang la las 'di skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang gi phyir mi rtag pa gsungs zhes dris na /
analyzed: yang la las 'di skad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gang gi phyir mi rtag pa gsungs zhes dris na /
translated: if someone were to ask, “For what reason did the Buddha, the Blessed One, say that all phenomena are impermanent?”

original: de la ni de @334a *//
analyzed: de la ni de @334a *//
translated: the Tathāgata would answer,

original: bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi chos kyi phyir mi rtag go zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pas 'dus byas kyi chos kyi phyir mi rtag go zhes bshad de /
translated: “It is because of conditioned phenomena that I say they are impermanent.”

original: bdag med pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of selflessness.

original: ji ltar ngas chos thams cad ni tshig pa'o zhes gsungs pa las gzhan zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang gi phyir chos thams cad tshig par gsungs zhes dris na /

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas mdo 'di las 'di skad du sems can thams cad la nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes smra na de ni zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas mdo 'di las 'di skad du sems can thams cad la nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes smra na de ni zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata says in this sūtra, ‘If one says that all sentient beings definitely have buddha-nature, that is attachment.

original: med do zhes smra na de ni brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ste /🔽mkhas pa shes rab can dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: med do zhes smra na de ni brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ste / mkhas pa shes rab can dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: If one says they do not, that is lying.

original: med pa'ang ma yin zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: The wise and the learned should say that buddha-nature is neither existent nor nonexistent.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dngos po bzhi 'dus pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po bzhi 'dus pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the coming together of four things.

original: bzhi gang zhe na; mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / chags pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na; mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / chags pa ste /
translated: What are the four? The eye, form, light, and attachment.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de ni mig ma yin /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de ni mig ma yin /
translated: The nature of the eye consciousness is not the eye,

original: gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin /
translated: not form,🔽not light,🔽not space,🔽not the coming together of those,🔽and not separate from those.

original: snang ba ma yin /
analyzed: snang ba ma yin /
translated: It is not a manifestation.

original: chags pa ma yin yang 'dus @342a *//
analyzed: chags pa ma yin yang 'dus @342a *//
translated: It is not attachment.

original: pa las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: It arises from a combination.

original: de ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa ni thog ma med la da yod par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa ni thog ma med la da yod par gyur to //
translated: In this way, eye consciousness has no beginning, but it comes to be.

original: yod nas kyang phyis med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir thog ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba med par rigs /
analyzed: yod nas kyang phyis med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir thog ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba med par rigs /
translated: Having been, it will later cease to be. Therefore, it is reasonable to say that it has no intrinsic nature at the beginning.

original: de bzhin du 'o ma'i nang na zho'i rang bzhin yod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'o ma'i nang na zho'i rang bzhin yod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is the same with the nature of yogurt in milk.

original: gang la las 'di skad du chu la zho'i rang bzhin med pas zho mi 'byung gi 'o ma'i nang na nges par zho'i rang bzhin yod do zhes zer na de'ang de ltar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang la las 'di skad du chu la zho'i rang bzhin med pas zho mi 'byung gi 'o ma'i nang na nges par zho'i rang bzhin yod do zhes zer na de'ang de ltar mi rung ngo //
translated: If someone were to say, “Since the nature of yogurt does not exist in water, yogurt does not arise from it. But the nature of yogurt definitely exists in milk,” that would not be correct.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos thams cad ni rgyu tha dad la 'bras bu tha dad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rgyu tha dad la 'bras bu tha dad de /
translated: all phenomena have different causes and different effects.

original: rgyu gcig las 'bras bu thams cad skye ba'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu gcig las 'bras bu thams cad skye ba'ang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that all effects arise from a single cause.

original: 'bras bu thams cad rgyu gcig las 'byung ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad rgyu gcig las 'byung ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that all causes give rise to a single effect.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dngos po rnam pa bzhi po de las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pas dngos po de bzhi las rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'ang skye'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa bzhi po de las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pas dngos po de bzhi las rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'ang skye'o zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: From these four things, the eye consciousness is produced. It is not possible to say that from these four things, the ear consciousness is produced.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: thabs spangs te 'o ma las zhor gyur pa dang / zho las mar 'byung mi srid de /
analyzed: thabs spangs te 'o ma las zhor gyur pa dang / zho las mar 'byung mi srid de /
translated: If you abandon skillful means, it is impossible for yogurt to come from milk, or for butter to come from yogurt.

original: de ltar mi srid pa la bltas na thabs mkhas pa dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar mi srid pa la bltas na thabs mkhas pa dgos so //
translated: If you see that it is impossible, you need skillful means.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽thabs mkhas pa dag ni thabs spangs pa'i pha rol na 'o ma las zhor gyur pa mi blta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / thabs mkhas pa dag ni thabs spangs pa'i pha rol na 'o ma las zhor gyur pa mi blta ste /
translated: Son of good family!🔽Those with skillful means do not see yogurt coming from milk if they abandon skillful means,

original: mar gyi bar du thabs spangs pa'i pha rol na mar du gyur par mi blta'o //
analyzed: mar gyi bar du thabs spangs pa'i pha rol na mar du gyur par mi blta'o //
translated: up to not seeing butter coming from butter if they abandon skillful means.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bas na ngas mdo sde 'di las rgyu skye bas chos yod la /
analyzed: de bas na ngas mdo sde 'di las rgyu skye bas chos yod la /
translated: Therefore, in this sūtra I have taught that dharmas exist because of the arising of causes,🔽and that dharmas do not exist because of the cessation of causes.

original: rgyu 'gags pas chos med do zhes gsungs @342b so; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags pas chos med do zhes gsungs @342b so; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / lan tshva'i mtshan nyid ni lan tshva mi bro ba thams cad la lan tshva bro bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na / lan tshva'i mtshan nyid ni lan tshva mi bro ba thams cad la lan tshva bro bar byed do //
translated: For example, the defining characteristic of salt is that it makes all that is not salty salty.

original: gal te lan tshva mi bro ba rnams la thog ma nas lan tshva'i rang bzhin yod pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te lan tshva mi bro ba rnams la thog ma nas lan tshva'i rang bzhin yod pa zhig yin na /
translated: If the non-salty were to have the nature of salt from the beginning,

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pas lan tshva tshol bar byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pas lan tshva tshol bar byed /
translated: why would worldly people search for salt?

original: ji ste thog ma nas med pa zhig yin na thog ma nas med la da yod par rig go /
analyzed: ji ste thog ma nas med pa zhig yin na thog ma nas med la da yod par rig go /
translated: But if it were to be non-existent from the beginning, it would be known as non-existent from the beginning and existent now.

original: 'on te rkyen gzhan gyis lan tshva bro bar gyur tam /
analyzed: 'on te rkyen gzhan gyis lan tshva bro bar gyur tam /
translated: Or, is it that salt becomes salty due to other conditions?

original: gang yang 'di skad du lan tshva mi bro thams cad la lan tshva'i rang bzhin yod de /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du lan tshva mi bro thams cad la lan tshva'i rang bzhin yod de /
translated: Or, it is said that all non-salty things have the nature of salt,

original: shas chung bas mi shes kyi /
analyzed: shas chung bas mi shes kyi /
translated: but due to its small quantity, it is not known.

original: shas cung zad yod pa'i rang bzhin des na lan tshvas lan tshva bro bar byed do //
analyzed: shas cung zad yod pa'i rang bzhin des na lan tshvas lan tshva bro bar byed do //
translated: By that nature of slight quantity, salt makes salt salty.

original: gal te thog ma nas rang bzhin med na lan tshva yod du zin kyang lan tshva bro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te thog ma nas rang bzhin med na lan tshva yod du zin kyang lan tshva bro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were to be without nature from the beginning, even if salt existed, it would not become salty.

original: dper na / sa bon nyid la chen po bzhi yod pas phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi'i rkyen gyis myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / yal ga dang / lo ma skye bar 'gyur ba ltar lan tshva'i rang bzhin yang de dang 'dra'o zhes smra na /
analyzed: dper na / sa bon nyid la chen po bzhi yod pas phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi'i rkyen gyis myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / yal ga dang / lo ma skye bar 'gyur ba ltar lan tshva'i rang bzhin yang de dang 'dra'o zhes smra na /
translated: For example, since the seed itself has the four great elements, the sprout, the stem, the branches, and the leaves grow by the conditions of the four great elements outside. The nature of salt is also like that.

original: de'ang de ltar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'ang de ltar mi rung ngo //
translated: That is also not so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lan tshva mi bro ba la thog ma nas lan tshva'i rang bzhin yod na lan tshva la'ang lan tshva mi bro ba'i shas yod pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: lan tshva mi bro ba la thog ma nas lan tshva'i rang bzhin yod na lan tshva la'ang lan tshva mi bro ba'i shas yod pa'i rigs so //
translated: If the nature of salt existed from the beginning in what is not salty, it would be reasonable that salt would also have a portion that is not salty.

original: gal te lan tshva la de ltar rang bzhin gnyid yod na ci'i phyir lan tshva bro ba dgos par spyod par ma gyur /
analyzed: gal te lan tshva la de ltar rang bzhin gnyid yod na ci'i phyir lan tshva bro ba dgos par spyod par ma gyur /
translated: If salt had such a dual nature, why would it not be used for what is not salty?

original: de bas na lan tshva la thog ma nas rang bzhin gnyis med par shes te /
analyzed: de bas na lan tshva la thog ma nas rang bzhin gnyis med par shes te /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that salt does not have a dual nature from the beginning.

original: ji ltar lan tshva dang 'dra bar lan tshva mi bro ba thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lan tshva dang 'dra bar lan tshva mi bro ba thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as with salt, all that is not salty is also like that.

original: @343a *// gal te phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi'i mthus nang gi chen po bzhi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'ang de ltar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: @343a *// gal te phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi'i mthus nang gi chen po bzhi skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'ang de ltar mi rung ngo //
translated: If you say that the four great elements of the internal are produced by the power of the four great elements of the external, that is also not so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: thabs mkhas pa ma yin gyi; rim gyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa ma yin gyi; rim gyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not skillful, but rather an explanation in stages.

original: 'o ma las zho 'byung ba nas mar gyi bar du chos thams cad kyang thabs med par grub pa med pa ltar chen po bzhi'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'o ma las zho 'byung ba nas mar gyi bar du chos thams cad kyang thabs med par grub pa med pa ltar chen po bzhi'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as milk produces curds, and so on, up to butter, and all things are not established without skillful means, the four great elements are also like that.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi las nang gi chen po bzhi skyes na ci'i phyir nang gi chen po bzhi las phyi'i chen po bzhi skye bar mi mthong /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi las nang gi chen po bzhi skyes na ci'i phyir nang gi chen po bzhi las phyi'i chen po bzhi skye bar mi mthong /
translated: If the four great elements of the internal are produced from the four great elements of the external, why is it that the four great elements of the external are not seen to be produced from the four great elements of the internal?

original: dper na / shing tog shi ri sha zhes bya ba dang mtshungs te; dbyibs med snying po med mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / shing tog shi ri sha zhes bya ba dang mtshungs te; dbyibs med snying po med mod kyi /
translated: For example, it is like the fruit of the śirīṣa tree, which has no shape and no essence.

original: skar ma pa ba sangs mthong ba na 'bras bu sor lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skar ma pa ba sangs mthong ba na 'bras bu sor lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the star Anurādhā is seen, a five-finger-width fruit will grow.

original: de ltar 'bras bu de yang dag par phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu de yang dag par phyi rol gyi chen po bzhi las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the effect is not produced from the four great elements of the external world.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: ji ltar ngas mdo sde bcu gnyis gsungs pa'ang /
analyzed: ji ltar ngas mdo sde bcu gnyis gsungs pa'ang /
translated: The twelve types of sutras that I have taught

original: la la ni bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad /
analyzed: la la ni bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad /
translated: are explained in accordance with my own mind,

original: la la ni gzhan gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad /
analyzed: la la ni gzhan gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad /
translated: in accordance with the minds of others,

original: la la ni bdag dang gzhan gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad do //
analyzed: la la ni bdag dang gzhan gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad do //
translated: and in accordance with both my own and others’ minds.

original: de la ji ltar na bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa zhe na /
translated: What does it mean to explain in accordance with my own mind?🔽It is like the following analogy:

original: ji ltar dge slong lnga brgyas sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad dris pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong lnga brgyas sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad dris pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: Five hundred monks asked Śāriputra,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyi rgyur gsungs pa ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lus kyi rgyur gsungs pa ji lta bu lags /
translated: “Venerable One, what did the Bhagavān say about the causes of the body?”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: btsun pa khyed so so nas yang dag par rnam par grol ba thob pas shes pa'i @343b rigs na ci'i rkyen gyis de skad ces 'dri /
analyzed: btsun pa khyed so so nas yang dag par rnam par grol ba thob pas shes pa'i @343b rigs na ci'i rkyen gyis de skad ces 'dri /
translated: “Venerable ones, since you have each attained perfect liberation, you should know the causes of the body. Why do you ask?”

original: de la dge slong kha cig ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la dge slong kha cig ni 'di skad du /
translated: Among them, some monks said,🔽“Venerable One, the Bhagavān said that the body is produced from the four great elements.”

original: btsun pa / bdag yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ma thob pa na 'di snyam du ma rig pa ni lus kyi rgyu'o snyam bsams te /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ma thob pa na 'di snyam du ma rig pa ni lus kyi rgyu'o snyam bsams te /
translated: “Reverend, when I had not yet attained perfect liberation, I thought, ‘Ignorance is the cause of the body.’

original: de ltar yid la byed pa na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: When I contemplated in this way, I attained the fruit of arhatship.

original: de la kha gcig ni 'di skad du btsun pa bdag yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ma thob pa na sred pa dang ma rig pa ni lus kyi rgyu'o snyam bsams te /
analyzed: de la kha gcig ni 'di skad du btsun pa bdag yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ma thob pa na sred pa dang ma rig pa ni lus kyi rgyu'o snyam bsams te /
translated: “Some of them thought, ‘Reverend, when I had not yet attained perfect liberation, I thought, “Craving and ignorance are the cause of the body.”

original: de ltar yid la byed pa na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: When I contemplated in this way, I attained the fruit of arhatship.’

original: de la kha cig ni 'di skad du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / drug gi skye mched dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni 'di skad du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / drug gi skye mched dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang /
translated: “Some of them thought, ‘Formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, existence,

original: skye ba dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / 'dod pa lnga ni lus kyi rgyu yin no snyam sems so //
analyzed: skye ba dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / 'dod pa lnga ni lus kyi rgyu yin no snyam sems so //
translated: birth, food and drink, the five desires, are the cause of the body.’🔽“Some of them thought,

original: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po so so nas bdag bdag gi shes pa smras nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste /
analyzed: de nas dge slong lnga brgya po so so nas bdag bdag gi shes pa smras nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ste /
translated: Then the five hundred monks each spoke of their own understanding and went to where the Bhagavān was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas g-yas su lan gsum bskor te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag btsal nas g-yas su lan gsum bskor te /
translated: They bowed to the Bhagavān’s feet, circumambulated him three times to the right,

original: phyag byas zin nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod de /
analyzed: phyag byas zin nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod de /
translated: and after paying homage, sat to one side.

original: so so nas ji ltar bdag bdag gis rig pa'i don bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / de nas sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: so so nas ji ltar bdag bdag gis rig pa'i don bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / de nas sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Each one requested the Bhagavān to explain the meaning of what they had understood. Then Śāriputra requested the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: dge slong de dag la gang ni yang dag par smra ba lags /
analyzed: dge slong de dag la gang ni yang dag par smra ba lags /
translated: which of these monks spoke correctly

original: gang ni yang dag par smra ba ma lags /
analyzed: gang ni yang dag par smra ba ma lags /
translated: and which did not speak correctly?”

original: bcom @344a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @344a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

original: dge slong dag ni yang dag par ma smras pa ni gcig kyang med do //
analyzed: dge slong dag ni yang dag par ma smras pa ni gcig kyang med do //
translated: There is not a single monk who did not speak correctly.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: ” Śāriputra requested,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs la ci dgongs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs la ci dgongs /
translated: what was in the Bhagavān’s mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: ngas 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams kyi phyir pha ma ni lus kyi rgyu yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ngas 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams kyi phyir pha ma ni lus kyi rgyu yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: I have taught that for sentient beings in the desire realm, parents are the cause of the body.

original: de ltar mdo sde gsungs pa de ni bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mdo sde gsungs pa de ni bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the sūtra that was taught in this way is called ‘an explanation that accords with my own mind.’

original: de la ji ltar na gzhan gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na gzhan gyi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa zhe na /
translated: “How is it an explanation that accords with the minds of others?

original: dper na / khyim bdag pa ta la zhes bya ba de nga gang na bar 'ongs nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: dper na / khyim bdag pa ta la zhes bya ba de nga gang na bar 'ongs nas 'di skad du /
translated: For example, a householder named Patalia came to where I was and said,

original: kye goo ta ma khyod sgyu ma shes sam /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma khyod sgyu ma shes sam /
translated: ‘Hey Gautama, do you know magic?

original: gal te sgyu ma shes na rgyu ma chen po yin no //
analyzed: gal te sgyu ma shes na rgyu ma chen po yin no //
translated: If you know magic, you are a great magician.

original: gal te sgyu ma mi shes na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes can ma yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: gal te sgyu ma mi shes na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes can ma yin no zhes smras so //
translated: If you do not know magic, you are not omniscient.’

original: ngas smras pa /
analyzed: ngas smras pa /
translated: I said,

original: khyim bdag / sgyu ma shes pa'i mi la sgyu ma zhes bya'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag / sgyu ma shes pa'i mi la sgyu ma zhes bya'am /
translated: ‘Householder, is a person who knows magic called a magician?’

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: ‘Excellent, excellent!’

translated: as you have seen,

original: sems can dbul phongs pa bzhin mdog mi sdug cing mdangs med pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshul khrims bshig pa'i dri ma'i sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang / khrel ba dang 'dzem pa med pa'i sems dang bcas pa yin par rig go /
analyzed: sems can dbul phongs pa bzhin mdog mi sdug cing mdangs med pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshul khrims bshig pa'i dri ma'i sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang / khrel ba dang 'dzem pa med pa'i sems dang bcas pa yin par rig go /
translated: those sentient beings who are poor and destitute, with ugly complexions and no luster, should be known to have minds tainted by the destruction of ethical discipline, minds of anger, and minds lacking in shame and embarrassment.”

original: gal te sems can gang nor mang la rab tu phyug cing dbang po dang ldan te /
analyzed: gal te sems can gang nor mang la rab tu phyug cing dbang po dang ldan te /
translated: If there are sentient beings who are wealthy, with much property and endowed with faculties,

original: gzi brjid dang rang dbang yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / khrel ba dang / 'dzem pa yod de /
analyzed: gzi brjid dang rang dbang yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / khrel ba dang / 'dzem pa yod de /
translated: and if they have dignity and independence, then they must have morality, generosity, diligence, shame, and conscience.

original: phrag dog dang zhe sdang med pa yin par rig ste /
analyzed: phrag dog dang zhe sdang med pa yin par rig ste /
translated: They must be free of envy and hatred.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i tshig go /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i tshig go /
translated: This is the word of the result.

original: ji ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig ce na /
translated: How is it the word of cause and result?

original: ji ltar mdo sde las bshad pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde las bshad pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: It is as explained in the sūtras.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sems can gyi de ltar gyi skye mched drug dang / reg bya'i rgyu ni 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: sems can gyi de ltar gyi skye mched drug dang / reg bya'i rgyu ni 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: the cause of the six sense bases and the cause of contact of sentient beings is the result of past karma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang las so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang las so zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Tathāgata is also karma.

original: las de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig go /
analyzed: las de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig go /
translated: The attainment of the future result by that cause and that condition is the word of cause and result.

original: ji ltar na dpe'i tshig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dpe'i tshig ce na /
translated: How is it the word of example?

original: ji ltar seng ge'i rgyal po la nga'i sku'i dper len pa ltar bal glang gi rgyal po chen po dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po dang / shing pa ri tsi tra dang / rin po che sna bdun gyi phung po dang / rgya mtsho dang /
analyzed: ji ltar seng ge'i rgyal po la nga'i sku'i dper len pa ltar bal glang gi rgyal po chen po dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po dang / shing pa ri tsi tra dang / rin po che sna bdun gyi phung po dang / rgya mtsho dang /
translated: Just as the lion king is taken as an example for my body, so too the great king of elephants, the great king of nāgas, the pāricchattaka tree, the heap of the seven precious substances, the ocean,

original: ri rab dang / sa chen po dang / char chen po dang / gru mkhan dang / ded dpon dang / skyes bu 'dul ba dang / stobs @347b po che dang / khyu mchog dang / bram ze dang / dge sbyong dang / grong khyer chen po dang /
analyzed: ri rab dang / sa chen po dang / char chen po dang / gru mkhan dang / ded dpon dang / skyes bu 'dul ba dang / stobs @347b po che dang / khyu mchog dang / bram ze dang / dge sbyong dang / grong khyer chen po dang /
translated: Mount Meru, the great earth, the great rain, the ship captain, the caravan leader, the one who tames beings, the great powerful one, the bull, the brahmin, the ascetic, the great city,

original: shing ta la dang / dpe'i mdo de lta bu dag ni dpe'i tshig go /
analyzed: shing ta la dang / dpe'i mdo de lta bu dag ni dpe'i tshig go /
translated: the palm tree, and the sūtra of examples are examples.

original: ji ltar na smra ba'i mi rigs pa'i tshig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na smra ba'i mi rigs pa'i tshig ce na /
translated: What are the words of the unsuitable speech?

original: ngas mdo sde las gnam sa gnyis 'byar bar 'gyur ba dang / rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed la phyogs bzhi'i ri 'ong ngo zhes bshad pa dang / ji ltar dge bsnyen ma khri sna sa la'i ma la gal te shing s'a la 'di khrims brgyad srung nus na /
analyzed: ngas mdo sde las gnam sa gnyis 'byar bar 'gyur ba dang / rgyal po sde rab tu pham byed la phyogs bzhi'i ri 'ong ngo zhes bshad pa dang / ji ltar dge bsnyen ma khri sna sa la'i ma la gal te shing s'a la 'di khrims brgyad srung nus na /
translated: I would rather say that the sutras explain that the sky and earth will join together, that the king who completely defeats his enemies will be struck by a mountain from the four directions, and that the lay vow holder Sāla’s mother will experience the happiness of gods and humans if she is able to observe the eight vows,

original: lha dang mi'i bde ba'ang myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la phyir ldog pa'i sems yod do zhes bshad kyang bla'i /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i bde ba'ang myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la phyir ldog pa'i sems yod do zhes bshad kyang bla'i /
translated: and that the bodhisattva on the tenth ground has a mind that turns back,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la tshig rnam pa gnyis yod do zhes mi smra ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa ngan song gsum du lhung ngo zhes smra ba'ang bla'i /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la tshig rnam pa gnyis yod do zhes mi smra ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa ngan song gsum du lhung ngo zhes smra ba'ang bla'i /
translated: than to say that the Tathāgata has two kinds of words, and I would rather say that a stream enterer falls into the three lower realms,

original: sa bcu pa la phyir ldog pa'i sems yod do zhes smra ba de ni smra ba'i mi rigs pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la phyir ldog pa'i sems yod do zhes smra ba de ni smra ba'i mi rigs pa'i tshig go /
translated: than to say that the mind of one on the tenth ground turns back.

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten spel ba'i tshig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten spel ba'i tshig ce na /
translated: How is it that these are words that increase the world?

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las skyes pa dang / bud med dang / chen po dang / chung ngu dang / song ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / shing rta dang / theg pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las skyes pa dang / bud med dang / chen po dang / chung ngu dang / song ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / shing rta dang / theg pa dang /
translated: As the Blessed One has said, The words 'male' and 'female,' 'great' and 'small,' 'gone' and 'come,' 'standing' and 'lying down,' 'chariot' and 'vehicle,'

original: gnas khang dang / khang pa dang / bum pa dang / gos dang / sems can dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / dmag gi tshogs dang / nags tshal dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang /
analyzed: gnas khang dang / khang pa dang / bum pa dang / gos dang / sems can dang / rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / dmag gi tshogs dang / nags tshal dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang /
translated: house' and 'hut,' 'pot' and 'cloth,' 'sentient being' and 'permanent,' 'happiness' and 'self,' 'purity' and 'army,' 'forest' and 'village,'

original: dge @348a *// 'dun dang / sgyu ma dang / 'dus pa dang / gyes pa de dag ni 'jig rten spel ba'i tshig go /
analyzed: dge @348a *// 'dun dang / sgyu ma dang / 'dus pa dang / gyes pa de dag ni 'jig rten spel ba'i tshig go /
translated: monastery' and 'illusion,' 'assembly' and 'dispersal' are words that proliferate in the world.

original: ji ltar na yid bzhin gyi tshig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yid bzhin gyi tshig ce na /
translated: How are they wish-fulfilling words?

original: ji ltar ngas sdom pa nyams pa la spyos nas bdag 'gyod de tshul khrims sdom par gyur ba dang / ngas rgyun du zhugs pa la bstod pas bus pa ma rabs dag dge ba'i sems bskyed par gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la bstod pas sems can rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar ngas sdom pa nyams pa la spyos nas bdag 'gyod de tshul khrims sdom par gyur ba dang / ngas rgyun du zhugs pa la bstod pas bus pa ma rabs dag dge ba'i sems bskyed par gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la bstod pas sems can rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang /
translated: As I have said, I scolded one who had broken his vows, and he felt remorse and became restrained in his discipline. I praised a stream-enterer, and a young man of low birth generated a virtuous mind. I praised a bodhisattva, and sentient beings generated the mind of awakening.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal bshad pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi phyir chos thams cad tshig pa zhes bshad pa dang / bdag med pa'ang de dang 'dra bar thams cad bag med pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal bshad pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi phyir chos thams cad tshig pa zhes bshad pa dang / bdag med pa'ang de dang 'dra bar thams cad bag med pa dang /
translated: I explained the sufferings of the three lower realms in order to cultivate virtuous qualities, and I explained that all phenomena are burning in order to cultivate conditioned phenomena. I explained that selflessness is like that, and that all of them are careless.

original: le lo med par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes bshad pa de dag ni yid bzhin gyi tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: le lo med par bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes bshad pa de dag ni yid bzhin gyi tshig ces bya'o //
translated: I explained that all sentient beings have the buddha-nature in order to be without laziness and carelessness. Those are called wish-fulfilling words.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa'i gsung yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa'i gsung yod do //
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata’s speech is connected with the minds of others and is explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Tathāgata’s buddha nature is twofold:

original: yod pa dang / med pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa'o //
translated: existent and nonexistent.

original: de la yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The existent is as follows:

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gsum dang / byams @348b pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa snyed dang /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gsum dang / byams @348b pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa snyed dang /
translated: the thirty-two marks, the eighty minor marks, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three establishments of mindfulness, great love, great compassion, and immeasurable samādhis such as the heroic samādhi,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa tshad med pa snyed dang thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa snyed dang / ye shes lnga la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa snyed ni yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa tshad med pa snyed dang thabs mkhas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa snyed dang / ye shes lnga la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa snyed ni yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The immeasurable samādhis such as the vajra-like samādhi, the immeasurable samādhis such as skillful means, and the immeasurable samādhis such as the five wisdoms are called existing.

original: de la med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, non-existent is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'das pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston dang / las dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / phung po lnga dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis ni med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'das pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston dang / las dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / phung po lnga dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis ni med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The past virtues of the Tathāgata, the non-virtues, the indeterminate, the actions, the causes, the effects, the ripening, the afflictions, the five aggregates, and the twelve links of dependent origination are called non-existent.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ji ltar yod pa dang med pa dang 'dra bar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa dang / 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa dang med pa dang 'dra bar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten ma yin pa dang / 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Just as it is with existence and nonexistence, so it is with virtue and nonvirtue, with the contaminated and the uncontaminated, with the mundane and the supramundane, with the ārya and the non-ārya,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba dang / rtsod pa dang rtsod pa ma yin pa dang / khams dang / khams ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba dang / rtsod pa dang rtsod pa ma yin pa dang / khams dang / khams ma yin pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: with the conditioned and the unconditioned, with the real and the unreal, with the peaceful and the not peaceful, with the disputed and the undisputed, with the elements and the non-elements, with the afflictions and the non-afflictions,

original: len pa dang len pa ma yin pa dang / lung ston pa dang lung ston pa ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang yod pa ma yin pa dang / dus gsum dang dus gsum ma yin pa dang / dus dang dus @349a *//
analyzed: len pa dang len pa ma yin pa dang / lung ston pa dang lung ston pa ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang yod pa ma yin pa dang / dus gsum dang dus gsum ma yin pa dang / dus dang dus @349a *//
translated: with the appropriated and the non-appropriated, with the predicted and the unpredicted, with the existent and the nonexistent, with the three times and the non-three times, and with the time and the non-time.

original: ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / bde ba dang bde ba med pa dang / yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
analyzed: ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / bde ba dang bde ba med pa dang / yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang /
translated: the permanent and the impermanent, the self and the self-less, happiness and suffering, purity and impurity, form, feeling, perception,

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin pa dang / nang gi skye mched dang / nang gi skye mched ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ma yin pa dang / nang gi skye mched dang / nang gi skye mched ma yin pa dang /
translated: mental formations, and consciousness, not form, not feeling, not perception, not mental formations, and not consciousness, the inner sense sources and not the inner sense sources,

original: phyi'i skye mched dang / phyi'i skye mched ma yin pa dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis ma yin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched dang / phyi'i skye mched ma yin pa dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis ma yin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the outer sense sources and not the outer sense sources, the twelve links of dependent origination and not the twelve links of dependent origination, are called the existence and nonexistence of the Tathāgata’s buddha-nature.

original: log sred can gyis sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa dang med pa'i bar du de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: log sred can gyis sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa dang med pa'i bar du de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those who are attached to false views are the same as to whether the Buddha-nature exists or not.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: ngas sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: ngas sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: I have said that all sentient beings have Buddha-nature,

original: sems can rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa'i gsung yin par mi shes so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gi yid dang sbyar te bshad pa'i gsung yin par mi shes so //
translated: but sentient beings do not know that the Tathagata's speech is in accord with their minds and is explained.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: tshig de dag ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang shes par mi nus na theg pa gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis shes pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: tshig de dag ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang shes par mi nus na theg pa gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag gis shes pa lta ci smos /
translated: Those words cannot be known even by a Bodhisattva who is hindered by only one birth, let alone by those of the two vehicles and other Bodhisattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: nga sngon dus gcig na bya rgod spungs pa'i ri la bzhugs te /
analyzed: nga sngon dus gcig na bya rgod spungs pa'i ri la bzhugs te /
translated: Once, I was dwelling on Vulture Peak,

original: @349b byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i gtam byas pa na /
analyzed: @349b byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i gtam byas pa na /
translated: and when Maitreya Bodhisattva and I were discussing the conventional truth,

original: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos lnga brgyas dngos po de dag shes par ram /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa nyan thos lnga brgyas dngos po de dag shes par ram /
translated: did the five hundred Shravakas such as Shariputra know those things?

original: rig par ma gyur na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: rig par ma gyur na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa lta ci smos /
translated: If one does not understand this, how could one understand the supramundane, ultimate truth?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni log sred can la yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni log sred can la yod de /
translated: some buddha-natures exist in those with wrong views,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba can la med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba can la med do //
translated: but not in those with roots of virtue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba can la yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba can la yod de /
translated: Some buddha-natures exist in those with roots of virtue,

original: log sred can la med do /
analyzed: log sred can la med do /
translated: but not in those with wrong views.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni gnyis ka la yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni gnyis ka la yod de /
translated: Some buddha-natures exist in both,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni gnyis ka la med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin la la ni gnyis ka la med do //
translated: and some buddha-natures exist in neither.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nga'i nye gnas rnams las gang tshig rnam pa bzhi po dag gi don shes pa ni log sred can la nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod dam /
analyzed: nga'i nye gnas rnams las gang tshig rnam pa bzhi po dag gi don shes pa ni log sred can la nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod dam /
translated: among my disciples, those who understand the meaning of these four statements should not ask whether those with wrong views definitely have buddha-nature

original: nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin med ces dri bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nges par sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin med ces dri bar mi bya'o //
translated: or whether they definitely do not have buddha-nature.

original: gang sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gi yid dang sbyar te gsungs pa'i tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gi yid dang sbyar te gsungs pa'i tshig ces bya ste /
translated: The statement all sentient beings have buddha-nature is a statement that accords with the minds of sentient beings.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas kyang bdag gi yid dang sbyar te gsungs na /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas kyang bdag gi yid dang sbyar te gsungs na /
translated: If the Tathagata has made such statements in accordance with the minds of sentient beings,

original: ci'i phyir sems can gyis phyogs gcig tu lta bar byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can gyis phyogs gcig tu lta bar byed /
translated: why do sentient beings view it in a one-sided way?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi nang gi sems can rnam pa bdun po ni rtag tu nub pa dang / skad cig phyung nas phyir nub pa dang / byung nas gnas par gyur pa dang / byung nas phyogs bzhi kun tu lta pa @350a *//
analyzed: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi nang gi sems can rnam pa bdun po ni rtag tu nub pa dang / skad cig phyung nas phyir nub pa dang / byung nas gnas par gyur pa dang / byung nas phyogs bzhi kun tu lta pa @350a *//
translated: For example, the seven kinds of sentient beings in the Ganges River are: those who always sink, those who occasionally emerge but then sink again, those who emerge and then stay, those who emerge and look around in the four directions,

original: dang / kun tu bltas nas song ba dang / song nas sdod pa dang / chu dang skams gnyis kar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dang / kun tu bltas nas song ba dang / song nas sdod pa dang / chu dang skams gnyis kar 'gro ba'o //
translated: those who look around and then move on, those who move on and then stop, and those who go both in the water and on land.

original: de la rtag tu nub pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rtag tu nub pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, those who always sink are like this:

original: nya chen po mi dge ba'i las chen po rnam par smin te lus lci bas chu'i gting na gnas te /
analyzed: nya chen po mi dge ba'i las chen po rnam par smin te lus lci bas chu'i gting na gnas te /
translated: The great fish is the great nonvirtuous karma that ripens and remains in the depths of the water because of its heavy body.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu nub pa'o //🔽skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub pa ni nya chen po dge mi dge ba'i las rnam par smin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu nub pa'o // skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub pa ni nya chen po dge mi dge ba'i las rnam par smin te /
translated: Therefore, it is always submerged.

original: lus lci bas mi zab par gnas te /🔽skad cig tsam snang ba'i 'od mthong bar gyur te /
analyzed: lus lci bas mi zab par gnas te / skad cig tsam snang ba'i 'od mthong bar gyur te /
translated: The fish that appears for a moment and then sinks again is the great fish of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma that ripens and remains in the shallows because of its heavy body.

original: snang ba'i rkyen gyis skad cig tsam byung yang lus lci bas phyir yang nub bo //
analyzed: snang ba'i rkyen gyis skad cig tsam byung yang lus lci bas phyir yang nub bo //
translated: It sees the light for a moment and then sinks again because of its heavy body.

original: byung nas gnas pa ni nya de byid ces bya ba chu mi zab pa la gnas shing snang ba'i 'od mthong bar dga'o //
analyzed: byung nas gnas pa ni nya de byid ces bya ba chu mi zab pa la gnas shing snang ba'i 'od mthong bar dga'o //
