translated: The fish that appears and remains is the fish called “sleeping” that remains in the shallows and enjoys seeing the light.

original: byung nas phyogs kun tu lta ba ni nya tshag gu zhes bya ba zas tshol ba'i phyir phyogs bzhi kun tu blta'o //
analyzed: byung nas phyogs kun tu lta ba ni nya tshag gu zhes bya ba zas tshol ba'i phyir phyogs bzhi kun tu blta'o //
translated: The fish that appears and looks in all directions is the fish called “greedy” that looks in all four directions in search of food.

original: bltas nas song ba ni nya tshag gu zhes bya ba rgyang nas zas ci mthong yang zas yin snyam ste /
analyzed: bltas nas song ba ni nya tshag gu zhes bya ba rgyang nas zas ci mthong yang zas yin snyam ste /
translated: The fish that looks and then goes is the fish called “greedy” that thinks whatever food it sees in the distance is food.

original: myur bar 'gro ba ni bltas nas song ba'o //
analyzed: myur bar 'gro ba ni bltas nas song ba'o //
translated: “Swiftly going” means going after looking.

original: song nas sdod pa ni nya de der phyin nas bzar rung ba zhig rnyed na sdod pa ni song nas sdod pa'o //
analyzed: song nas sdod pa ni nya de der phyin nas bzar rung ba zhig rnyed na sdod pa ni song nas sdod pa'o //
translated: “Having gone, staying” means that when the fish has arrived there and finds something suitable to eat, it stays.

original: chu dang skams gnyis kar 'gro ba ni rus sbal lo //
analyzed: chu dang skams gnyis kar 'gro ba ni rus sbal lo //
translated: “Going in both water and on land” is the tortoise.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po chu klung dam pa'i nang na'ang sems can rnam pa bdun yod de /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po chu klung dam pa'i nang na'ang sems can rnam pa bdun yod de /
translated: in the great river of the good nirvāṇa there are seven kinds of sentient beings.

original: rtag tu nub pa nas bdun pa la thug gi bar du bra 'ga' ni nub /
analyzed: rtag tu nub pa nas bdun pa la thug gi bar du bra 'ga' ni nub /
translated: From “always submerged” up to “the seventh” are the various kinds.🔽Some are submerged,

original: bar 'ga' ni @350b phyir 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni @350b phyir 'byung ngo //
translated: some come out.

original: de la rtag tu nub pa zhes bya ba ni gang la la zhig gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di las de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu gnas pa /
analyzed: de la rtag tu nub pa zhes bya ba ni gang la la zhig gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di las de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu gnas pa /
translated: Among them, “always submerged” means that someone, having heard this Great Nirvana Sutra, says, “The Tathāgata always abides,

original: 'gyur zhing 'pho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur zhing 'pho ba med pa ste /
translated: without changing or transforming.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang yongs su dag pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang yongs su dag pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las mi 'dra'o //
translated: He is permanent, blissful, self, and pure, and in the end does not enter nirvāṇa.”

original: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod de /
translated: All sentient beings have the nature of the Buddha.

original: log sred can dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo la skur ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga kha na ma tho ba byas pa dang / rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa'ang gdon mi za bar byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: log sred can dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo la skur ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga kha na ma tho ba byas pa dang / rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa'ang gdon mi za bar byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Even those with wrong views, those who slander the Vaipulya sūtras, those who have committed the five deadly sins, and those who have violated the four root precepts, will without doubt be awakened to supreme enlightenment.🔽Even those who have entered the stream, those who will return only once more, those who will not return, those who are arhats, and pratyekabuddhas will without doubt attain supreme awakening.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dag kyang gdon mi za ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa thos na dad pa'i sems mi skye ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dag kyang gdon mi za ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa thos na dad pa'i sems mi skye ste /
translated: When he hears this, he will not give rise to a faithful mind.

original: de 'di snyam du bsams nas 'di skad ces smra'o //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bsams nas 'di skad ces smra'o //
translated: Thinking this, he will say,

original: yongs su mya nga las 'das pa'i mdo 'di ni mu stegs can gyi yi ge ste /
analyzed: yongs su mya nga las 'das pa'i mdo 'di ni mu stegs can gyi yi ge ste /
translated: “This Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra is the writing of the tīrthikas.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes smras nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes smras nas /
translated: It is not the word of the Buddha.”

original: de'i tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral te dam pa'i chos ma ma thos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral te dam pa'i chos ma ma thos so //
translated: At that time, they are separated from spiritual friends and do not hear the true Dharma.

original: ci ste res 'ga' thos na'ang yid la byed mi nus so //
analyzed: ci ste res 'ga' thos na'ang yid la byed mi nus so //
translated: Even if they sometimes hear it, they are unable to pay attention.

original: ji ltar yid la byed na'ang dge ba yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar yid la byed na'ang dge ba yid la mi byed do //
translated: Even if they do pay attention, they do not pay attention to the wholesome.

original: dge ba yid la mi byed pas mi dge ba'i chos la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba yid la mi byed pas mi dge ba'i chos la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they do not pay attention to the wholesome, they abide in unwholesome dharmas.

original: mi dge ba'i chos la gnas pa la rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos la gnas pa la rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Abiding in unwholesome dharmas has six aspects:

original: 'di ltar mi dge @351a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dge @351a *//
translated: Thus, unwholesomeness,

original: pa dang / dge ba med pa dang / chos dme bar byed pa dang / srid pa skye ba dang / nyon mongs pas gdungs pa dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong ba ste /
analyzed: pa dang / dge ba med pa dang / chos dme bar byed pa dang / srid pa skye ba dang / nyon mongs pas gdungs pa dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong ba ste /
translated: lack of wholesomeness, corrupting the Dharma, giving rise to existence, being tormented by afflictions, and experiencing the fruits of unwholesomeness.

original: de ni nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called sinking.

original: de la ji ltar nub ce na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar nub ce na /
translated: How does one sink?

original: dge ba'i sems med pa dang / rtag tu mi dge ba spyod pa dang / gnyen po la nan tan mi byed pa ni nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems med pa dang / rtag tu mi dge ba spyod pa dang / gnyen po la nan tan mi byed pa ni nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Lacking wholesome thoughts, always engaging in unwholesomeness, and not practicing the antidotes is called sinking.

original: de la mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyis smod pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sems skye ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis spong ba dang / sems can la phan pa'i don du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyis smod pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sems skye ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis spong ba dang / sems can la phan pa'i don du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “Nonvirtue” means that which is despised by the noble ones, that which gives rise to fear, that which is rejected by spiritual teachers, and that which does not serve the purpose of benefiting sentient beings.

original: dge ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu tshad med pa snyed skye bar byed pa dang / ma rig pas rtag tu glags pa dang / mi ngan pa la bsten cing mdza' bar byed pa dang / dge ba la nan tan byed pa'i thabs med pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba med pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu tshad med pa snyed skye bar byed pa dang / ma rig pas rtag tu glags pa dang / mi ngan pa la bsten cing mdza' bar byed pa dang / dge ba la nan tan byed pa'i thabs med pa dang /
translated: “Lack of virtue” means that which gives rise to immeasurable results of nonvirtue, that which is always seized by ignorance, that which causes one to rely on and befriend evil people, and that which lacks the means to practice virtue.

original: sems phyin ci log tu gyur te rtag tu nor ba'i phyir dge ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log tu gyur te rtag tu nor ba'i phyir dge ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Lack of virtue” also means that which is contrary to the mind and always mistaken.

original: de la chos dme bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag rtag tu dme bar byed pa dang / sems can rnam par dag pa dme bar byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i las skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos spong bar byed pa'i phyir chos dme bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos dme bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag rtag tu dme bar byed pa dang / sems can rnam par dag pa dme bar byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i las skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos spong bar byed pa'i phyir chos dme bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “To make the Dharma impure” means to make the body and speech impure, to make pure sentient beings impure, to produce nonvirtuous karma, and to abandon virtuous dharmas.

original: de la sred pa skyed pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gong ma gsum po ltar byas na sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags su skye bar @351b 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sred pa skyed pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gong ma gsum po ltar byas na sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags su skye bar @351b 'gyur te /
translated: “To produce craving” means that if one acts as in the above three, one will be reborn in the hells, as an animal, or as a hungry ghost.

original: rnam par grol ba'i chos la nan tan mi byed cing lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las srid pa rnams la mi skyo ba ni srid pa skyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i chos la nan tan mi byed cing lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las srid pa rnams la mi skyo ba ni srid pa skyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “To produce existence” means not to practice the Dharma of liberation, and not to be weary of the existences of body, speech, and mind.

original: nyon mongs pas gdungs pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gong ma bzhi po ltar rdzogs par byas pas lus dang sems nyon mongs par gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas gdungs pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gong ma bzhi po ltar rdzogs par byas pas lus dang sems nyon mongs par gyur te /
translated: “To be tormented by afflictions” means that if one completes the above four, one will be tormented in body and mind.

original: zhi ba spong ba'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya /🔽sems can dmyal ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya /
analyzed: zhi ba spong ba'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya / sems can dmyal ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya /
translated: It is called “torment” because it destroys peace.🔽It is called “torment” because it experiences the ripening of hell.

original: sems can rnams tshig pa'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can rnams tshig pa'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya /
translated: It is called “torment” because it burns sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad tshig pa'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad tshig pa'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “torment” because it burns all wholesome natures.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: dad pa'i sems ni bsil zhing tshim pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i sems ni bsil zhing tshim pa ste /
translated: the mind of faith is cool and refreshing,

original: de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gdung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and because it is not present, it is called ‘torment.’

original: mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gong ma lnga po ltar rdzogs par byas pas shi nas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi khams su ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gong ma lnga po ltar rdzogs par byas pas shi nas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi khams su ltung ba'o //
translated: ‘Experiencing the fruits of nonvirtue’ means that, just as in the above five cases, one dies and falls into the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i dngos po rnam pa gsum gyis mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i dngos po rnam pa gsum gyis mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: there are also three kinds of nonvirtuous things that are called ‘experiencing the fruits of nonvirtue.’

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: nyon mongs pa mi dge ba dang / las mi dge ba dang / rnam par smin pa mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi dge ba dang / las mi dge ba dang / rnam par smin pa mi dge ba ste /
translated: Afflictions are nonvirtuous, actions are nonvirtuous, and the fruitions are nonvirtuous.

original: de ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the experience of the fruition of nonvirtue.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang zag la gong ma'i dngos po rnam pa drug dang ldan na dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag la gong ma'i dngos po rnam pa drug dang ldan na dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'gyur te /
translated: if a person has six superior things, he will sever his roots of virtue.

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byed pa dang / rtsa ba bzhi'i sdom pa 'jig pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la skur pa 'dabs pa dang / dge @352a *//
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byed pa dang / rtsa ba bzhi'i sdom pa 'jig pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la skur pa 'dabs pa dang / dge @352a *//
translated: He commits the five heinous acts, destroys the four basic precepts, slanders the Three Jewels,🔽and acts with contempt toward the wealth of the saṅgha.

original: 'dun gyi nor la thugs thub tu spyod pa dang / chos ma yin pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dun gyi nor la thugs thub tu spyod pa dang / chos ma yin pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs byed par 'gyur te /
translated: He engages in various unrighteous acts.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal bar nub ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal bar nub ste /
translated: For that cause and that condition, he sinks into the Avīci Hell.

original: lus myong ba'ang chu zheng dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed do //
analyzed: lus myong ba'ang chu zheng dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed do //
translated: The body he experiences there is eighty-four thousand leagues in height and width.

original: de'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis las rab tu lci bas 'byung bar mi nus so; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis las rab tu lci bas 'byung bar mi nus so; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems la dge ba'i chos bskyed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la dge ba'i chos bskyed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are unable to generate wholesome dharmas in their minds.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang mi mthong mi thos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang mi mthong mi thos te /
translated: Even if countless Tathāgatas appear in the world, they do not see or hear them.

original: de bas na klung gangg'a'i nya chen po dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de bas na klung gangg'a'i nya chen po dang mtshungs te /
translated: They are like a large fish in the Ganges River.

original: nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “sinking.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ngas log sred can dag ni rtag tu nub pa yin no zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: ngas log sred can dag ni rtag tu nub pa yin no zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: I have said that those with wrong views always sink.

original: rtag tu nub pa yin la log sred can ma yin pa yin pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: rtag tu nub pa yin la log sred can ma yin pa yin pa'ang yod do //
translated: But there are also those who always sink but are not those with wrong views.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: Who are they?

original: gang srid pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims srung ba'i dge ba spyod pa ni rtag tu nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang srid pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims srung ba'i dge ba spyod pa ni rtag tu nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who practice wholesome conduct such as generosity and upholding precepts for the sake of existence are said to always sink.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dge ba rnam pa 'di bzhis ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba rnam pa 'di bzhis ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: through these four kinds of wholesome [actions], one will attain the fruits of unwholesomeness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gzhan las 'phags par 'dod pa'i phyir mdo sde dang yi ge klog cing 'dod pa dang / rnyed pa dang grags pa'i phyir tshul khrims sdom pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang byed par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin pa byed pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi phyir rtse @352b gcig tu yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan las 'phags par 'dod pa'i phyir mdo sde dang yi ge klog cing 'dod pa dang / rnyed pa dang grags pa'i phyir tshul khrims sdom pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang byed par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin pa byed pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi phyir rtse @352b gcig tu yid la byed pa ste /
translated: They read the sūtras and the letters for the sake of being superior to others, they observe moral discipline and vows for the sake of gain and fame, they give gifts for the sake of controlling others, and they one-pointedly attend to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: dge ba'i dngos po de bzhis ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i dngos po de bzhis ni mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these four wholesome things, the result of unwholesomeness ripens.

original: gang de lta bu'i dngos po bzhi ltar spyod pa ni nub nas phyir byung la byung nas phyir nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang de lta bu'i dngos po bzhi ltar spyod pa ni nub nas phyir byung la byung nas phyir nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who practices like these four things is said to have emerged from the setting and to have set from the emerging.

original: ci'i phyir nub pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nub pa zhe na /
translated: Why does one set?

original: srid pa gsum la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa gsum la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is devoted to the three existences.

original: ci'i phyir byung ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byung ba zhe na /
translated: Why does one emerge?

original: snang ba'i 'od mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i 'od mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees the light of appearance.

original: de la snang ba'i 'od ni thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de la snang ba'i 'od ni thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The light of appearance refers to hearing, morality, giving, and samādhi.

original: ci'i phyir nub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nub ce na /
translated: Why does it disappear?

original: ngan par lta ba dang / nga rgyal bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngan par lta ba dang / nga rgyal bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of generating bad views and pride.

original: de bas na ngas mdo sde las tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ngas mdo sde las tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, I have spoken these verses in the sūtras:

original: sems can gang gis srid pa la mos te //
analyzed: sems can gang gis srid pa la mos te //
translated: Sentient beings who aspire to existence

original: srid pas dge dang mi dge'i las byed na //
analyzed: srid pas dge dang mi dge'i las byed na //
translated: And create virtuous and nonvirtuous karma through existence

original: de ni mya ngan lam las bslad pa ste //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan lam las bslad pa ste //
translated: Are deceived by the path of suffering.

original: skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub pa'o //
translated: They appear for a moment and then disappear again.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho mun par 'gro ba dag //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho mun par 'gro ba dag //
translated: Beings in the dark ocean of saṃsāra

original: rnam par grol yang nyon mongs bcas pa yin //
analyzed: rnam par grol yang nyon mongs bcas pa yin //
translated: Are liberated but still have afflictions.

original: des ni mi dge'i 'bras bu phyir len te //
analyzed: des ni mi dge'i 'bras bu phyir len te //
translated: They take back the results of nonvirtue

original: skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub par 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub par 'gyur //
translated: And appear for a moment and then disappear again.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nya chen po ni snang ba'i 'od mthong ba'i phyir skad cig phyir byung yang lus lci bas phyir nub pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: nya chen po ni snang ba'i 'od mthong ba'i phyir skad cig phyir byung yang lus lci bas phyir nub pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: just as the great fish appears for a moment because it sees the light but then disappears again because its body is heavy,

original: gong ma'i gang zag rnam pa gnyis kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i gang zag rnam pa gnyis kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The two kinds of superior persons are also like this.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gal te gang zhig srid pa gsum la chags pa ni nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gang zhig srid pa gsum la chags pa ni nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If someone is attached to the three realms of existence, this is called “submersion.”

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'di thos nas dad pa'i sems bskyed pa ni byung ba @353a *//
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'di thos nas dad pa'i sems bskyed pa ni byung ba @353a *//
translated: Having heard this Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra, to give rise to a mind of faith is called “emergence.”

original: zhes bya'o // ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: For what cause and what conditions is it called “emergence”?

original: mdo sde 'di thos nas mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di thos nas mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs te /
translated: Having heard this sūtra, one abandons all unwholesome dharmas

original: dge ba'i chos sgom pa ni byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sgom pa ni byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and cultivates wholesome dharmas, which is called “emergence.”

original: dad pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: dad pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there is faith,

original: ldan pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: it is not called “possession.”

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: For what cause and what conditions is it called “lacking faith”?

original: gang zag des yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa yin par dad mod kyi /
analyzed: gang zag des yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa yin par dad mod kyi /
translated: Although that person has faith in the great parinirvāṇa being permanent, blissful, self, and pure,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni mi rtag pa dang / bde ba med pa dang / bdag med pa dang / yongs su dag pa med pa zhes zer te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni mi rtag pa dang / bde ba med pa dang / bdag med pa dang / yongs su dag pa med pa zhes zer te /
translated: The body of the Tathāgata is impermanent, not blissful, not self, and impure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The nirvāṇa of the Tathāgata is of two kinds:

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa med do //
translated: In the conditioned nirvāṇa there is no permanence, no bliss, no self, and no purity.🔽In the unconditioned nirvāṇa there is permanence, bliss, self, and purity.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa yod do zhes sems can la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par yid ches mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa yod do zhes sems can la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par yid ches mod kyi /
translated: Although they believe that sentient beings have the Buddha-nature,

original: nges par thams cad la yod par yid mi ches te /
analyzed: nges par thams cad la yod par yid mi ches te /
translated: they do not believe that it exists in all sentient beings.

original: de bas na dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called “those without faith.”

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽dad pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / dad pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Son of noble family,🔽faith is of two kinds:

original: dad pa dang / tshol ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / tshol ba'o //
translated: faith and seeking.

original: gang zag de la dad pa yod mod kyi tshol zhing rtsol mi nus te /
analyzed: gang zag de la dad pa yod mod kyi tshol zhing rtsol mi nus te /
translated: Although that person has faith, he is unable to seek and strive.

original: de bas na dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is not called one who has faith.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds:

original: thos pa @353b las skyes pa dang / bsams pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa @353b las skyes pa dang / bsams pa las skye ba'o //
translated: that which arises from hearing and that which arises from reflection.

original: de'i dad pa thos pa las skyes te /
analyzed: de'i dad pa thos pa las skyes te /
translated: His faith arises from hearing,

original: bsams pa las ma skyes pas na dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las ma skyes pas na dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but not from reflection. Therefore, he is called one who does not have faith.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds:

original: byang chub yod par dad pa dang / thob pa yod par dad pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub yod par dad pa dang / thob pa yod par dad pa'o //
translated: faith in the existence of enlightenment and faith in the existence of attainment.

original: de'i dad pa'i sems ni tshul khrims sdom pa dang / byang chub yod par dad mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i dad pa'i sems ni tshul khrims sdom pa dang / byang chub yod par dad mod kyi /
translated: His mind has faith in the existence of enlightenment and in the restraint of moral discipline,

original: thob pa yod par yid mi ches pa ni dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thob pa yod par yid mi ches pa ni dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but he does not believe in the existence of attainment. Therefore, he is called one who does not have faith.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds:

original: yang dag pa la dad pa dang / log pa la dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa la dad pa dang / log pa la dad pa'o //
translated: faith in the true teaching and faith in false teachings.

original: gang rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang yod /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang yod /
translated: He has faith in the existence of cause and effect,

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yang yod do zhes smra ba ni yang dag pa la dad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yang yod do zhes smra ba ni yang dag pa la dad pa'o //
translated: The Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṃgha do exist. This is called faith in the real.

original: gang rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang med /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang med /
translated: Those who say, There is neither cause nor effect,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyang tha dad do zhes smra ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyang tha dad do zhes smra ste /
translated: and the characteristics of the Three Jewels are different,🔽 are called those who have faith in the false.

original: 'od srung rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i ngan par lta ba la yid ches pa ni log pa la dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i ngan par lta ba la yid ches pa ni log pa la dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who believe in the bad views of Pūraṇa Kāśyapa and others are called those who have faith in the false.

original: gang zag des sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la dad mod kyi /
analyzed: gang zag des sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la dad mod kyi /
translated: Those who have faith in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṃgha,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan nyid gcig par yid mi ches pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par dad mod kyi /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi mtshan nyid gcig par yid mi ches pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par dad mod kyi /
translated: but do not believe that the characteristics of the Three Jewels are the same, and although they have faith in the existence of cause and effect,

original: thob par yid mi ches pa ni dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thob par yid mi ches pa ni dad pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: do not believe in attainment, are called those who lack faith.

original: gang dad pa dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims ma nos pa dang yang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dad pa dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims ma nos pa dang yang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who lack faith do not uphold the precepts.

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis mi ldan pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis mi ldan pa zhe na /
translated: Why is it so? What is the cause and condition for lacking it?

original: rgyu dang mi ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because he is not endowed with the cause, he is not endowed with morality.

original: yang ci'i phyir mi ldan pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽tshul khrims la rnam pa @354a *//
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mi ldan pa zhes bya zhe na / tshul khrims la rnam pa @354a *//
translated: Why is he not endowed?🔽Morality is of two kinds:

original: gnyis te / cho ga'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gnyis te / cho ga'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of ritual and the morality of restraint.

original: gang cho ga'i tshul khrims 'ba' zhig dang ldan te /
analyzed: gang cho ga'i tshul khrims 'ba' zhig dang ldan te /
translated: He who is endowed only with the morality of ritual

original: tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and is not endowed with the morality of restraint is said to be not endowed with morality.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, it is of two kinds:

original: byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / mi byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of action and the morality of non-action.

original: gang byed pa'i tshul khrims 'ba' zhig dang ldan la /
analyzed: gang byed pa'i tshul khrims 'ba' zhig dang ldan la /
translated: He who is endowed only with the morality of action

original: mi byed pa'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi byed pa'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and is not endowed with the morality of non-action is said to be not endowed with morality.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, it is of two kinds:

original: lus dang ngag gis yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba thob pa dang / lus dang ngag gis yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba mthob pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gis yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba thob pa dang / lus dang ngag gis yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba mthob pa'o //
translated: and the attainment of right livelihood by way of body and speech.

original: gang lus dang ngag gis yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ma thob pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang lus dang ngag gis yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ma thob pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who does not attain right livelihood by way of body and speech is said to be lacking in morality.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there are two kinds:

original: tshol ba'i tshul khrims dang / gtong ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshol ba'i tshul khrims dang / gtong ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of seeking and the morality of giving.

original: gang srid pa tshol ba'i tshul khrims 'ba' zhig dang ldan te /
analyzed: gang srid pa tshol ba'i tshul khrims 'ba' zhig dang ldan te /
translated: One who has only the morality of seeking existence

original: gtong ba'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtong ba'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and does not have the morality of giving is said to be lacking in morality.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there are two kinds:

original: srid pa la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: srid pa la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of devotion to existence and the morality of devotion to enlightenment.

original: gang srid pa 'ba' zhig la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: gang srid pa 'ba' zhig la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims dang ldan zhing /
translated: One who has only the morality of devotion to existence🔽and does not have the morality of devotion to enlightenment is said to be lacking in morality.

original: byang chub la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub la gzhol ba'i tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He who is not endowed with the morality that is directed toward enlightenment is called “immoral.”

original: tshul khrims sla yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims sla yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Morality is twofold:

original: dge ba'i tshul khrims @354b dang; mi dge ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dge ba'i tshul khrims @354b dang; mi dge ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: virtuous morality and nonvirtuous morality.

original: de la lus dang ngag dang yid dge ba ni dge ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag dang yid dge ba ni dge ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Among them, virtuous morality is the virtue of body, speech, and mind.

original: ba lang gi brtul zhugs dar khyi'i brtul zhugs ni mi dge ba'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: ba lang gi brtul zhugs dar khyi'i brtul zhugs ni mi dge ba'i tshul khrims te /
translated: The morality of the cow and the morality of the dog are nonvirtuous morality.

original: gang zhig tshul khrims de gnyis la dge ba'i 'bras bu yod par yid ches pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig tshul khrims de gnyis la dge ba'i 'bras bu yod par yid ches pa ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He who believes that these two moralities have virtuous results is called “immoral.”

original: de ltar dad pa dang tshul khrims kyi dngos po de gnyis dang mi ldan pa ni mang du thos pa la nan tan byed pa dang yang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dad pa dang tshul khrims kyi dngos po de gnyis dang mi ldan pa ni mang du thos pa la nan tan byed pa dang yang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he who is not endowed with these two things, faith and morality, is also not endowed with the practice of learning.

original: de la ji ltar na thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “not endowed with learning”?

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde bcu gnyis la /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde bcu gnyis la /
translated: If one has faith in the twelve divisions of the scriptures taught by the Tathāgata,

original: sde drug la dad de /
analyzed: sde drug la dad de /
translated: and in the six divisions of the scriptures,

original: sde drug la ma dad pa ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sde drug la ma dad pa ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but has no faith in the six divisions of the scriptures, that is called “lacking in learning.”

original: de ltar mdo sde sde drug 'dzin kyang klog pa dang / 'don pa dang / gzhan la ston mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar mdo sde sde drug 'dzin kyang klog pa dang / 'don pa dang / gzhan la ston mi nus te /
translated: Even if one upholds the six divisions of the scriptures in that way, one is unable to read, recite, explain to others,

original: phan pa'i don byed mi nus pa ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i don byed mi nus pa ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and perform beneficial actions, so that is called “lacking in learning.”

original: de ltar yang mdo sde sde drug 'dzin pa'ang rtsod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo sde sde drug 'dzin pa'ang rtsod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Even if one upholds the six divisions of the scriptures in that way, it is for the sake of debate,

original: gzhan las rgyal ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan las rgyal ba'am /
translated: to conquer others,

original: rnyed pa dang grags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang grags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: for the sake of gain and fame,

original: srid pa rnams kyi phyir 'dzin tam /
analyzed: srid pa rnams kyi phyir 'dzin tam /
translated: or for the sake of existence,

original: klog gam / 'don tam /
analyzed: klog gam / 'don tam /
translated: that one upholds, reads, recites,

original: 'chad pa ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni thos pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and explains, that is called “lacking in learning.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ngas mdo sde las thos pa dang ldan pa bshad de /
analyzed: ngas mdo sde las thos pa dang ldan pa bshad de /
translated: I have explained in the sūtras what it means to be learned.

original: ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What does it mean to be learned?

original: gal te dge slong gang lus dang / dgra dang / yid dge la /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gang lus dang / dgra dang / yid dge la /
translated: If a monk is virtuous in body, speech, and mind,

original: mkhan po dang / slob dpon rnams dang / yon tan can dag la sngar mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang / slob dpon rnams dang / yon tan can dag la sngar mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should first make offerings to the preceptors, the teachers, and those who have good qualities.

original: de ltar mchod pa byas na slob dpon de dag gis @355a *//
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa byas na slob dpon de dag gis @355a *//
translated: If one makes offerings in this way, those teachers

original: de la byams pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la byams pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: will give rise to a loving mind toward that person.

original: de'i rkyen gyis mdo sde dang chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis mdo sde dang chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the basis of that, they will teach the sūtras and the Dharma.

original: des kyang sems rtse gcig tu 'dzin cing 'don pa dang goms par byed do //
analyzed: des kyang sems rtse gcig tu 'dzin cing 'don pa dang goms par byed do //
translated: That person will then single-mindedly retain, recite, and practice them.

original: 'dzin cing 'don pa dang goms par byed pas shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin cing 'don pa dang goms par byed pas shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By retaining, reciting, and practicing them, they will attain wisdom.🔽Having attained wisdom, they will be very attentive and abide in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ltar shes rab thob nas shin tu yid la byed cing chos bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro; ;shin tu yid la byas te gnas nas yang dag pa'i don thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab thob nas shin tu yid la byed cing chos bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro; ;shin tu yid la byas te gnas nas yang dag pa'i don thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been very attentive and abided, they will attain the true meaning.

original: yang dag pa'i don thob nas lus dang sems dben par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don thob nas lus dang sems dben par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained the true meaning, their body and mind will become secluded.

original: lus dang sems dben par gyur nas dga' ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems dben par gyur nas dga' ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their body and mind having become secluded, a joyful mind will arise.

original: de ltar sems dga' ba'i rkyen gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi sems thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems dga' ba'i rkyen gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi sems thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, through the condition of mental joy, one attains the mind of meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sems thob pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sems thob pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of attaining the mind of meditative concentration, one attains right knowledge and right view.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba thob nas srid pa rnams la skyo ba'i sems skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba thob nas srid pa rnams la skyo ba'i sems skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained right knowledge and right view, one attains the mind of disgust with regard to existence.

original: srid pa rnams la skyo ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa rnams la skyo ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of disgust with existence, one attains liberation.

original: gang de lta bu'i dngos po dag med pa ni thob pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang de lta bu'i dngos po dag med pa ni thob pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is devoid of such things is said to be without attainment.

original: gang dngos po rnam pa gsum po de dang mi ldan pa ni sbyin pa dang yang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dngos po rnam pa gsum po de dang mi ldan pa ni sbyin pa dang yang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is devoid of these three kinds of things is also devoid of generosity.

original: de la sbyin pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of generosity:

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity with material things and generosity with the Dharma.

original: des zang zing gi sbyin pa byed mod kyi /
analyzed: des zang zing gi sbyin pa byed mod kyi /
translated: Although one may practice generosity with material things,

original: srid pa tshol lo //
analyzed: srid pa tshol lo //
translated: one seeks existence.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa @355b byed mod kyi /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa @355b byed mod kyi /
translated: Although one may practice generosity with the Dharma,

original: ldan par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldan par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not possess generosity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag pas lhag par 'gyur gyis dogs te bcabs nas thams cad mi ston pa ni sbyin pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag pas lhag par 'gyur gyis dogs te bcabs nas thams cad mi ston pa ni sbyin pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is afraid of being surpassed by others, he conceals his virtues and does not reveal them all.

original: zang zing dang chos kyi sbyin pa gnyis ka la rnam pa gnyis gnyis yod de /
analyzed: zang zing dang chos kyi sbyin pa gnyis ka la rnam pa gnyis gnyis yod de /
translated: Both material and Dharma generosity are twofold:

original: 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: of the noble ones and of the non-noble ones.

original: de la 'phags pa ni sbyin pa byas nas 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mi re'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa ni sbyin pa byas nas 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mi re'o //
translated: Among them, the noble ones, having given generosity, do not hope for the ripening of results.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni sbyin pa byas nas 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re'o //🔽'phags pa'i ni chos 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni sbyin pa byas nas 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la re'o // 'phags pa'i ni chos 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa byed do //
translated: The non-noble ones, having given generosity, hope for the ripening of results.🔽The noble ones give the gift of Dharma in order to increase the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni srid pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa byed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni srid pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa byed de /
translated: The non-noble ones give the gift of Dharma in order to increase their existence.

original: de ltar zang zing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zang zing gi sbyin pa byed pa dang / srid pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa byed pa ni sbyin pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zang zing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zang zing gi sbyin pa byed pa dang / srid pa 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir chos kyi sbyin pa byed pa ni sbyin pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, giving material gifts in order to increase material things and giving the gift of Dharma in order to increase existence is called “lacking in generosity.”

original: gzhan yang skye bo de mdo sde sde drug 'dzin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye bo de mdo sde sde drug 'dzin te /
translated: Moreover, those people uphold the six collections of sūtras.

original: gang chos 'dzin pa la ni dgos pa rnams sbyin par byed /
analyzed: gang chos 'dzin pa la ni dgos pa rnams sbyin par byed /
translated: To those who uphold the Dharma, they give what is necessary.

original: chos mi 'dzin pa la ni dgos pa sbyin par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos mi 'dzin pa la ni dgos pa sbyin par mi byed de /
translated: To those who do not uphold the Dharma, they do not give what is necessary.

original: de bas na sbyin pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “lacking in generosity.”

original: de ltar gang zag des gong ma'i dngos po bzhi dang mi ldan pa ni shes rab la nan tan byas pa dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gang zag des gong ma'i dngos po bzhi dang mi ldan pa ni shes rab la nan tan byas pa dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, those people who do not possess the four higher qualities will not even possess the practice of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of wisdom is to discern by nature.

original: gang zag des de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa yin nam /
analyzed: gang zag des de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa yin nam /
translated: Those people do not discern whether the Tathāgata is permanent

original: mi rtag pa yin pa bye brag mi phyed la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin pa bye brag mi phyed la /
translated: or impermanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas @356a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas @356a *//
translated: The Tathāgata is permanent.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'di las /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'di las / de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: In this Sutra of Final Nirvana,🔽the Tathagata is liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is liberation.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: don de dag gi bye brag mi phyed pa dang / rtogs par mi nus /
analyzed: don de dag gi bye brag mi phyed pa dang / rtogs par mi nus /
translated: One cannot distinguish the particulars of these meanings, nor can one understand them.

original: tshangs par spyod pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Pure action is the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byams pa dang / snying rje dang / btang snyoms dang / dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byams pa dang / snying rje dang / btang snyoms dang / dga' ba'o //
translated: The Tathagata is love, compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / btang snyoms dang; dga' ba nyid rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / btang snyoms dang; dga' ba nyid rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Love, compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity are liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberation is nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid tshad med pa bzhi'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid tshad med pa bzhi'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Nirvana is the four immeasurables.

original: don de dag kyang bye brag mi phyed pa ni shes rab dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de dag kyang bye brag mi phyed pa ni shes rab dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who cannot distinguish these meanings are said to be lacking in wisdom.

original: gzhan yang rnam par 'byed mi nus pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par 'byed mi nus pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, being unable to discriminate is the Buddha-nature, which is the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma 'dres pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ma 'dres pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: The Tathagata is all the unshared qualities.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos nyid rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos nyid rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The unshared qualities are liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberation is nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ma 'dres pa'i chos so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ma 'dres pa'i chos so zhes gsungs te /
translated: Nirvana is the unshared qualities.

original: don de dag kyang bye brag mi phyed pa ni shes rab dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de dag kyang bye brag mi phyed pa ni shes rab dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who cannot distinguish these meanings are said to be lacking in wisdom.

original: gzhan yang rnam par mi phyed pa ni @356b bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par mi phyed pa ni @356b bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, not discriminating is the four noble truths:

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo /
translated: suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi'i bye brag mi phyed pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i spyod pa mi shes so //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi'i bye brag mi phyed pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i spyod pa mi shes so //
translated: Because they cannot discriminate the four noble truths, they do not know the practice of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i spyod pa mi shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa mi shes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod pa mi shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa mi shes so //
translated: Because they do not understand the conduct of the noble ones, they do not understand the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba mi shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba mi shes so //
translated: Because they do not understand the Tathāgata, they do not understand the liberation of the Tathāgata.

original: rnam par grol ba mi shes pas mya ngan las 'das pa mi shes te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mi shes pas mya ngan las 'das pa mi shes te /
translated: Because they do not understand liberation, they do not understand nirvāṇa.

original: de bas na shes rab dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “lacking in wisdom.”

original: so so'i skye bo dag gong ma'i dngos po rnam pa lnga dang mi ldan pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag gong ma'i dngos po rnam pa lnga dang mi ldan pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: Ordinary beings, lacking the five higher things, are of two kinds:

original: dge ba'i chos bskyed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bskyed pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos bskyed pa'o //
translated: those who produce virtuous dharmas and those who produce non-virtuous dharmas.

original: de la ji ltar na mi dge ba'i chos bskyed pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na mi dge ba'i chos bskyed pa zhe na /
translated: How do they produce non-virtuous dharmas?

original: gang zag de bdag mi ldan pa mi mthong bas bdag gi ni ldan pa can no zhes zhen pa'i sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: gang zag de bdag mi ldan pa mi mthong bas bdag gi ni ldan pa can no zhes zhen pa'i sems bskyed nas /
translated: Because that person does not see the self as lacking, they give rise to the thought of clinging, thinking “mine is endowed.”

original: bslab pa mtshungs pa'i nang na bdag ni mchog yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: bslab pa mtshungs pa'i nang na bdag ni mchog yin no snyam ste /
translated: Thinking “I am supreme among those of equal training,”

original: de'i phyir bdag dang 'dra ba mi dge ba'i grogs dang bsten to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang 'dra ba mi dge ba'i grogs dang bsten to //
translated: they rely on non-virtuous companions who are like themselves.

original: de ltar bsten pas gzhan yang mi ldan pa'i chos thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsten pas gzhan yang mi ldan pa'i chos thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: By relying on them, one will also hear teachings that are not in accord with the Dharma.

original: thos nas sems dga' zhing zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thos nas sems dga' zhing zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: Having heard them, one will be pleased and will become attached to them.

original: rgyags pa dang dregs pa bskyed nas bag med pa mang du byed do //
analyzed: rgyags pa dang dregs pa bskyed nas bag med pa mang du byed do //
translated: Having generated pride and arrogance, one will become very heedless.

original: bag med pa'i rkyen gyis khyim pa dang sten cing khyim pa'i las bya ba dag smra ba dang thos pa la mos te /
analyzed: bag med pa'i rkyen gyis khyim pa dang sten cing khyim pa'i las bya ba dag smra ba dang thos pa la mos te /
translated: Due to the condition of heedlessness, one will associate with householders and will speak and listen to them about the activities of householders.

original: rab tu byung ba'i chos rnam par dag pa spong bar 'gyur /🔽de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mi dge @357a *//
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i chos rnam par dag pa spong bar 'gyur / de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mi dge @357a *//
translated: One will abandon the pure Dharma of the renunciant.

original: ba'i chos bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i chos bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to that cause and that condition, unwholesome dharmas will be generated.

original: mi dge ba'i chos bskyed pa'i phyir lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sgo nas rnam par ma dag pa'i las bskyed do //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos bskyed pa'i phyir lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sgo nas rnam par ma dag pa'i las bskyed do //
translated: Because unwholesome dharmas are generated, one will generate impure karma through body, speech, and mind.

original: las gsum yongs su ma dag pas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi khams bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las gsum yongs su ma dag pas sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi khams bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Due to the impurity of the three karmas, one will generate the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: de ni skad cig byung nas phyir nub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni skad cig byung nas phyir nub ces bya ba'o //
translated: That is called ‘arising in an instant and then disappearing.’

original: de skad cig byung nas phyir nub ces bya ba de'i chos la gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: de skad cig byung nas phyir nub ces bya ba de'i chos la gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena of those who arise in an instant and then disappear?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: lha sbyin dang / dge slong ku ka li dang / dge slong a'an shva dang / dge slong legs pa'i skar ma dang / dge slong te sha dang / dge slong skar ma rgyas dang / dge slong ma byams ma'i sa dang / dge slong ma dgon ma dang /
analyzed: lha sbyin dang / dge slong ku ka li dang / dge slong a'an shva dang / dge slong legs pa'i skar ma dang / dge slong te sha dang / dge slong skar ma rgyas dang / dge slong ma byams ma'i sa dang / dge slong ma dgon ma dang /
translated: Devadatta, the monk Kukura, the monk Aṃśu, the monk Śakra, the monk Tiṣya, the monk Pūrṇamāsa, the nun Maitrāyaṇī, the nun Āranyaka,

original: dge slong ma phyogs ma dang / dge slong ma dregs ma dang / khyim bdag rab gtsang dang / dge bsnyen srid tshol dang / shaka rigs sha li dang / khyim bdag bal glang dang / dge bsnyen ma grags ma dang / dge bsnyen ma 'od snang dang /
analyzed: dge slong ma phyogs ma dang / dge slong ma dregs ma dang / khyim bdag rab gtsang dang / dge bsnyen srid tshol dang / shaka rigs sha li dang / khyim bdag bal glang dang / dge bsnyen ma grags ma dang / dge bsnyen ma 'od snang dang /
translated: the nun Pāśā, the nun Mānavikā, the householder Praśānta, the lay brother Bhavakāra, the Śākya Śāli, the householder Hastaka, the lay sister Yaśomatī, the lay sister Prabhāvatī,🔽the lay sister Nandā, the lay brother Gaṇadeva, and the lay brother Ghaṇṭa.

original: dge bsnyen ma dga' mo dang / dge bsnyen ma tshogs sde dang / dge bsnyen ma dril bu zhes bya ba de dag la sogs pa na skad cig byung nas phyir nub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma dga' mo dang / dge bsnyen ma tshogs sde dang / dge bsnyen ma dril bu zhes bya ba de dag la sogs pa na skad cig byung nas phyir nub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those and others are said to arise in an instant and then disappear.

original: ji ltar nya chen po snang ba'i 'od mthong ba'i phyir byung la /
analyzed: ji ltar nya chen po snang ba'i 'od mthong ba'i phyir byung la /
translated: It is like a great fish that, because it sees the light, comes to the surface,

original: lus lci ba'i phyir phyir nub pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus lci ba'i phyir phyir nub pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: but then sinks again because of the heaviness of its body.

original: skyes bu de'i 'og mas ni bdag gi mthong ba dang spyod pa mi ldan par rtogs nas /
analyzed: skyes bu de'i 'og mas ni bdag gi mthong ba dang spyod pa mi ldan par rtogs nas /
translated: The next person, having understood that he does not have the same vision and conduct as the first person,

original: de ltar mi ldan par rtogs pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes @357b gnyen tshol zhing bsten to //
analyzed: de ltar mi ldan par rtogs pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes @357b gnyen tshol zhing bsten to //
translated: because he does not have the same understanding, seeks and follows a spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa'i phyir ma thos pa rnams 'dri bar mos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa'i phyir ma thos pa rnams 'dri bar mos so //
translated: Because he follows a spiritual friend, he is interested in asking questions about what he has not heard.

original: thos nas 'dzin par mos so //
analyzed: thos nas 'dzin par mos so //
translated: Having heard, he is interested in retaining it.

original: bzung nas rab tu yid la byed par dga'o //
analyzed: bzung nas rab tu yid la byed par dga'o //
translated: Having retained it, he delights in keeping it in mind.

original: rab tu yid la byas nas chos bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu yid la byas nas chos bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having kept it in mind, he will abide in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos bzhin du gnas nas dge ba'i chos 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: chos bzhin du gnas nas dge ba'i chos 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Having abided in accordance with the Dharma, he will increase in virtuous qualities.

original: dge ba'i chos 'phel ba'i phyir nam du'ang nub par mi 'gyur te; de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'phel ba'i phyir nam du'ang nub par mi 'gyur te; de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rtag tu dge ba'i 'od snang ba mthong bar mos pa ste /

analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis gal te sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: For this reason, whether or not a buddha appears in the world,

translated: these people will never commit evil deeds. This is called abiding, just as the sun is called the illuminator because it delights in shining its light and does not sink or set.

original: de bas na ngas mdo sde las tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ngas mdo sde las tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, I have spoken these verses in the sūtras:

original: gang gis don la rnam par 'byed mkhas shing //
analyzed: gang gis don la rnam par 'byed mkhas shing //
translated: Those who are skilled in discerning the meaning,

original: rtse gcig dge sbyong 'bras bu rab tshol te //
analyzed: rtse gcig dge sbyong 'bras bu rab tshol te //
translated: one-pointedly seeking the fruits of spiritual practice,

original: srid pa thams cad yongs su smod pa ni //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad yongs su smod pa ni //
translated: and who completely despise all existence

original: de ni chos bzhin gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos bzhin gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to abide in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gang gis bcom ldan tshad med la mchod na //
analyzed: gang gis bcom ldan tshad med la mchod na //
translated: Those who make immeasurable offerings to the Blessed One

original: skye ba grangs med par du lam sgom 'gyur //
analyzed: skye ba grangs med par du lam sgom 'gyur //
translated: will cultivate the path for countless rebirths.

original: 'jig rten bde ba myong la bag byed na //
analyzed: 'jig rten bde ba myong la bag byed na //
translated: “If one is careful in experiencing worldly happiness,🔽one is said to be abiding in the Dharma.

original: de ni chos bzhin gnas pa zhes @358b bya'o; ;dge ba'i bshes la bsten cing dam chos nyan //
analyzed: de ni chos bzhin gnas pa zhes @358b bya'o; ;dge ba'i bshes la bsten cing dam chos nyan //
translated: Relying on a spiritual friend, listening to the holy Dharma,

original: yid la byed de chos bzhin gnas pa ni //
analyzed: yid la byed de chos bzhin gnas pa ni //
translated: and contemplating it, one abides in the Dharma.

original: 'od zer mthong bar mos shing lam sgom ste //
analyzed: 'od zer mthong bar mos shing lam sgom ste //
translated: Seeing the light, one aspires to the path

original: rnam par grol ba'i bde gnas thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i bde gnas thob par 'gyur //
translated: and attains the bliss of liberation.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: shes rab dang mi ldan pa la dngos po rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang mi ldan pa la dngos po rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: those who lack wisdom have five things:

original: skyes bu des de ltar shes nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol lo //
analyzed: skyes bu des de ltar shes nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol lo //
translated: When that person knows this, he seeks a spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen nges kyang; 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rnam par rtog pa'i shas gang che ba brtags te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen nges kyang; 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / rnam par rtog pa'i shas gang che ba brtags te /
translated: Even if he finds a spiritual friend, he should examine which of the three poisons—desire, anger, or ignorance—and which of the various thoughts are strongest.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi shas che na mi gtsang ba'i rtog pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi shas che na mi gtsang ba'i rtog pa'i chos ston to //
translated: If desire is strongest, he should teach the Dharma of contemplating impurity.

original: zhe sdang gi shas che na byams pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi shas che na byams pa'i chos ston to //
translated: If anger is strongest, he should teach the Dharma of loving-kindness.

original: gti mug gi shas che na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ston to //
analyzed: gti mug gi shas che na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ston to //
translated: If ignorance is strongest, he should teach dependent origination.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shas che na dbugs bgrang ba ston to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shas che na dbugs bgrang ba ston to //
translated: If discursive thought predominates, then counting the breath is taught.

original: bdag tu lta ba la chags pa'i shas che na khams bco brgyad la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la chags pa'i shas che na khams bco brgyad la sogs pa ston to //
translated: If attachment to the view of self predominates, then the eighteen elements and so forth are taught.

original: de nas des thos nas sems rtse gcig tu gzungs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nas des thos nas sems rtse gcig tu gzungs su 'dzin to //
translated: Then, having heard this, one should hold it in mind one-pointedly.

original: sems kyis bzung nas chos bzhin du nan tan byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyis bzung nas chos bzhin du nan tan byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having held it in mind, one should practice in accordance with the Dharma.🔽By practicing in accordance with the Dharma, one gradually attains the four establishments of mindfulness and contemplates the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena.

original: chos bzhin du nan tan byas pas rim gyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi thob par gyur nas lus dang // tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la rjes su rtog par 'gyur ro; ;de ltar rjes su rtogs nas rim gyis rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis la rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bzhin du nan tan byas pas rim gyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi thob par gyur nas lus dang // tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la rjes su rtog par 'gyur ro; ;de ltar rjes su rtogs nas rim gyis rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bcu gnyis la rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having contemplated in this way, one gradually contemplates the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: de ltar rtogs nas drod kyi chos thob par 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems @359a *//
analyzed: de ltar rtogs nas drod kyi chos thob par 'gyur ro // byang chub sems @359a *//
translated: Having realized this, one attains the stage of heat.

original: dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: sems can thams cad la drod kyi chos mchis so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la drod kyi chos mchis so //
translated: All sentient beings possess the Dharma of heat.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnam pa gsum 'dus pa la 'di lta te /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnam pa gsum 'dus pa la 'di lta te /
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the three aspects of the Dharma come together:

original: 'tsho ba dang / drod dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las sems can zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang / drod dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las sems can zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: life, heat, and consciousness. When these three come together, it is called a sentient being.

original: de lta bas na sems can thams cad la thog ma nas drod ces bgyi ba mchis na /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can thams cad la thog ma nas drod ces bgyi ba mchis na /
translated: Therefore, if all sentient beings originally possess what is called heat,

original: ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas drod kyi chos ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rkyen gyis skye'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pas drod kyi chos ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rkyen gyis skye'o zhes gsungs /
translated: why did the Tathāgata say that the Dharma of heat is born from the condition of a spiritual friend?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis ji ltar drod kyi chos yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis ji ltar drod kyi chos yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Son of noble family, your statement that the Dharma of heat exists

original: sems can thams cad dang log sred can gyi bar du kun la yod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang log sred can gyi bar du kun la yod do //
translated: means that it exists in all sentient beings, up to those with wrong views.

original: ji ltar ngas drod kyi chos gsungs pa ni thabs mkhas pa'i rkyen gyis gdod thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar ngas drod kyi chos gsungs pa ni thabs mkhas pa'i rkyen gyis gdod thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The reason I said that the Dharma of heat is attained through the condition of skillful means is

original: thog ma med pa la nga yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa la nga yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no beginning, then there would be a self.

original: de bas na sems can thams cad la thog ma nas yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na sems can thams cad la thog ma nas yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that all sentient beings have it from the beginning.

original: khyod kyis sems can thams cad la drod kyi chos yod do zhes smra ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can thams cad la drod kyi chos yod do zhes smra ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable for you to say that all sentient beings have the attribute of heat.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni gzugs kyi khams kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni gzugs kyi khams kyi chos yin te /
translated: This attribute of heat is a phenomenon of the form realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist in the desire realm.

original: gal te sems can thams @359b cad la yod ces byar ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can la'ang yod pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: gal te sems can thams @359b cad la yod ces byar ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can la'ang yod pa'i rigs te /
translated: If it were said to exist in all sentient beings, then it would be reasonable for sentient beings in the desire realm to have it.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na med pa la bltas na thams cad la yod pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na med pa la bltas na thams cad la yod pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it is seen not to exist in the desire realm, it should be understood that it does not exist in all.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gzugs kyi khams na yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na yod mod kyi /
translated: Although it exists in the form realm,

original: thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not exist in all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nga'i nye gnas la ni yod kyi mu stegs can la ni med de /
analyzed: nga'i nye gnas la ni yod kyi mu stegs can la ni med de /
translated: It exists for my disciples but does not exist for non-Buddhists.

original: de lta bas na sems can thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist in all sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: mu stegs can thams cad ni spyod pa rnam pa drug 'ba' zhig la rtog go /
analyzed: mu stegs can thams cad ni spyod pa rnam pa drug 'ba' zhig la rtog go /
translated: All tīrthikas only imagine six kinds of conduct.

original: nga'i nye gnas rnams ni spyod pa bcu drug dang ldan te /
analyzed: nga'i nye gnas rnams ni spyod pa bcu drug dang ldan te /
translated: My disciples have sixteen kinds of conduct.

original: spyod pa bcu drug po de ni sems can kun la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa bcu drug po de ni sems can kun la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: These sixteen kinds of conduct are not present in all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: drod kyi chos zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar na drod ces bgyi /
analyzed: drod kyi chos zhes gsungs pa de ji ltar na drod ces bgyi /
translated: When you speak of the heat-like qualities, how are they heat?

original: rang bzhin gyis dro'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dro'am /
translated: Are they heat by nature,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis dro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis dro bar 'gyur /
translated: or do they become heat by other conditions?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni rang bzhin gyis dro ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni rang bzhin gyis dro ba yin te /
translated: In that way, those heat-like qualities are heat by nature,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis dro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis dro ba ma yin no //
translated: not heat by other conditions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar rta thul dang skar rgyal gnyis la drod kyi chos ma mchis so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar rta thul dang skar rgyal gnyis la drod kyi chos ma mchis so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One previously said that Aśvajit and Tiṣya do not have the heat-like qualities.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa'i sems ma mchis pa'i slad du drod ces bgyi ba ma mchis te /🔽de bas na dad pa'i sems @360a *//
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa'i sems ma mchis pa'i slad du drod ces bgyi ba ma mchis te / de bas na dad pa'i sems @360a *//

original: nyid drod kyi chos lags par 'tshal to //
analyzed: nyid drod kyi chos lags par 'tshal to //
