original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: dad pa ni drod kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: dad pa ni drod kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: faith is not the Dharma of heat.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dad pa'i sems kyi rkyen gyis phyis drod thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i sems kyi rkyen gyis phyis drod thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the condition of the mind of faith later obtains heat.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: drod kyi chos zhes bya ba ni shes rab yin no //
analyzed: drod kyi chos zhes bya ba ni shes rab yin no //
translated: the Dharma of heat is wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it realizes the four truths.

original: de bas na spyod pa bcu drug ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na spyod pa bcu drug ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the sixteen practices.

original: spyod pa nyid shes rab bo //
analyzed: spyod pa nyid shes rab bo //
translated: Practice itself is wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: ji ltar khyod kyis ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis drod ces bya ba ni rigs kyi bu drod ces bya ba nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyi me'i mtshan nyid yin pas drod ces bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis drod ces bya ba ni rigs kyi bu drod ces bya ba nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyi me'i mtshan nyid yin pas drod ces bya'o //
translated: why is it called heat? Good son, heat itself is the characteristic of the fire of the eightfold noble path, so it is called heat.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: dper na me gtsugs pa na thog ma drod 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na me gtsugs pa na thog ma drod 'byung ste /
translated: It is like when a fire is lit, first there is heat,

original: de nas me 'byung la /
analyzed: de nas me 'byung la /
translated: and then there is fire,

original: phyis gdod dud pa 'byung ba ltar zag pa med pa'i lam yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phyis gdod dud pa 'byung ba ltar zag pa med pa'i lam yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: and later there is smoke. The uncontaminated path is like this.

original: de la drod ces bya ba ni spyod pa bcu drug go /
analyzed: de la drod ces bya ba ni spyod pa bcu drug go /
translated: Here, what is called heat is the sixteen practices.

original: me zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: me zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: What is called fire is the fruit of stream-entry.🔽Smoke is like the complete elimination of afflictions through cultivating the path.

original: dud pa ni lam bsgoms pas kun nas nyon mongs pa bcad pa lta bu'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dud pa ni lam bsgoms pas kun nas nyon mongs pa bcad pa lta bu'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni srid pa'i chos kyang lags la /
analyzed: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni srid pa'i chos kyang lags la /
translated: this dharma of heat is a dharma of existence,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos kyang lags so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos kyang lags so //
translated: and it is also a conditioned dharma.

original: chos de'i rnam par smin pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi rkyen gyis lnga phung thob par 'gyur ba de'i phyir srid pa zhes bgyi ste /
analyzed: chos de'i rnam par smin pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi rkyen gyis lnga phung thob par 'gyur ba de'i phyir srid pa zhes bgyi ste /
translated: The ripening of that dharma is the attainment of the five aggregates conditioned by the form realm. Therefore, it is called existence.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis 'dus byas @360b zhes kyang bgyi'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis 'dus byas @360b zhes kyang bgyi'o //
translated: By that cause and those conditions, it is also called conditioned.

original: gal te 'dus byas lags na zag pa ma mchis pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas lags na zag pa ma mchis pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is conditioned, how can it be the characteristic of the uncontaminated path?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: khyod kyis ji ltar smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni 'dus byas dang srid pa'i chos yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar drod kyi chos de ni 'dus byas dang srid pa'i chos yin mod kyi /
translated: although the heat of Dharma is a conditioned and a worldly phenomenon,

original: 'dus byas dang srid pa'i chos kyang 'jig par nus te; de bas na zag pa med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang srid pa'i chos kyang 'jig par nus te; de bas na zag pa med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it is able to destroy conditioned and worldly phenomena, and therefore it is the characteristic of the uncontaminated path.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: ji ltar mi rta la zhon pa byams kyang byams la gzhu bar yang byed pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rta la zhon pa byams kyang byams la gzhu bar yang byed pa ltar /
translated: it is like a man riding a horse who, while loving the horse, also controls it.

original: drod kyi sems kyang de dang 'dra ste /🔽srid pa'i phyir skye ba len la /
analyzed: drod kyi sems kyang de dang 'dra ste / srid pa'i phyir skye ba len la /
translated: The heat of the mind is like that.🔽It takes birth in order to be in saṃsāra,

original: skye ba'i phyir 'du byed rtogs te /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir 'du byed rtogs te /
translated: and it creates formations in order to be born.

original: de bas na srid pa'i chos dang 'dus byas yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bas na srid pa'i chos dang 'dus byas yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, although it is a worldly phenomenon and a conditioned phenomenon,

original: yang dag pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: it is also the characteristic of the true path.”

original: drod kyi chos thob pa'i gang zag ni bdun cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: drod kyi chos thob pa'i gang zag ni bdun cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The person who has attained the stage of heat has seventy-three types.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: In the realm of desire, there are ten types.

original: gang zag nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ldan pa de cha gcig gcod pa nas cha dgu pa'i bar du gcod de /
analyzed: gang zag nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ldan pa de cha gcig gcod pa nas cha dgu pa'i bar du gcod de /
translated: The person who possesses all the passions cuts off one part up to the ninth part.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan dang po nas cung zad med pa'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan dang po nas cung zad med pa'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: As in the realm of desire, so also in the first meditation up to the sphere of nothingness.

original: de ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: These are called the seventy-three types.

original: gang zag de dag ni drod kyi chos thob pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa dang / mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho ba byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag de dag ni drod kyi chos thob pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa dang / mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho ba byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: These persons, having attained the stage of heat, do not cut off the roots of good, do not commit the actions of immeditate retribution, and do not violate the four roots of morality.

original: de'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two types:

original: dge @361a *// ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa dang / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: dge @361a *// ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa dang / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'o //
translated: meeting with a spiritual teacher and meeting with a bad teacher.

original: de la mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub bo //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni skad cig byung nas phyir yang nub bo //
translated: The meeting with a nonvirtuous friend is like a flash of lightning that quickly disappears.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni phyogs bzhi kun tu lta'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa ni phyogs bzhi kun tu lta'o //
translated: The meeting with a virtuous friend is like looking in the four directions.

original: de la phyogs bzhir lta ba ni spyi bo'i chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyogs bzhir lta ba ni spyi bo'i chos zhes bya ste /
translated: Looking in the four directions is called the Dharma of the crown.

original: spyi bo'i chos kyi rang bzhin nyid lnga phung ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: spyi bo'i chos kyi rang bzhin nyid lnga phung ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The nature of the Dharma of the crown is not the five aggregates.

original: de'ang bden pa bzhi la dmigs pas na de bas na phyogs bzhi kun tu lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'ang bden pa bzhi la dmigs pas na de bas na phyogs bzhi kun tu lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, since it focuses on the four truths, it is called looking in the four directions.

original: de ltar spyi bo'i chos thob nas rim gyis bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: de ltar spyi bo'i chos thob nas rim gyis bzod pa thob bo //
translated: Having thus attained the Dharma of the crown, one gradually attains acceptance.

original: bzod pa de'ang de dang 'dra bar rang bzhin nyid lnga phung ma yin yang /
analyzed: bzod pa de'ang de dang 'dra bar rang bzhin nyid lnga phung ma yin yang /
translated: That acceptance, like that, is not the five aggregates by nature.

original: bden pa bzhi la dmigs te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la dmigs te /
translated: It focuses on the four truths.

original: des rim gyis 'jig rten mchog gi chos thob po //
analyzed: des rim gyis 'jig rten mchog gi chos thob po //
translated: Through that, one gradually attains the Dharma of the supreme mundane state.

original: chos de'i rang bzhin yang lnga phung ma yin mo de kyi /
analyzed: chos de'i rang bzhin yang lnga phung ma yin mo de kyi /
translated: The nature of that Dharma is not the five aggregates.

original: bden pa bzhi la dmigs te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la dmigs te /
translated: It focuses on the four truths.

original: des rim gyis sdug bsngal la bzod pa'i chos thob bo //
analyzed: des rim gyis sdug bsngal la bzod pa'i chos thob bo //
translated: Through that, one gradually attains the Dharma of acceptance of suffering.

original: bzod pa'i rang bzhin ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i rang bzhin ni shes rab ste /
translated: The nature of patience is wisdom.

original: bden pa gcig la dmigs so //
analyzed: bden pa gcig la dmigs so //
translated: It focuses on one truth.

original: de ltar bzod pa'i chos kyis bden pa gcig la dmigs nas mthong ste spong ba'i nyon mongs pa chod de /
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa'i chos kyis bden pa gcig la dmigs nas mthong ste spong ba'i nyon mongs pa chod de /
translated: Thus, having focused on and seen one truth with the Dharma of patience, the afflictions to be abandoned are severed.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de ni phyogs bzhi kun tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de ni phyogs bzhi kun tu lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Attaining the fruit of stream entry, this is called “looking in all four directions.”

original: de la phyogs bzhi zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi la bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs bzhi zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi la bya'o //
translated: Here, the four directions refer to the four truths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa las /
translated: as the Bhagavān previously taught,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa nyon mongs @361b ba yongs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa nyon mongs @361b ba yongs su bcad pa ni /
translated: the afflictions to be severed by a stream enterer

original: dper na / chu zheng gab par li bzhi bcur gang ba'i chu dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / chu zheng gab par li bzhi bcur gang ba'i chu dang 'dra'o //
translated: are like the water in a pond forty cubits across and deep.

original: lhag ma ni spu'i nyag ma gcig gi thigs pa dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: lhag ma ni spu'i nyag ma gcig gi thigs pa dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs na /
translated: The remainder is like a drop of water on the tip of a hair.

original: ci'i slad du bdag tu lta ba dang / rgyu ma yin pa la ni rgyur lta ba dang / the tshom gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'di gsum bcad na rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bdag tu lta ba dang / rgyu ma yin pa la ni rgyur lta ba dang / the tshom gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang 'di gsum bcad na rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes gsungs /
translated: Why is it said that when the three afflictions of the view of the self, viewing what is not a cause as a cause and doubt are eliminated, one is a stream enterer?🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pas phyogs bzhi kun tu lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pas phyogs bzhi kun tu lta bar 'gyur /
translated: what are the causes and conditions for a stream-enterer to look in all four directions?

original: yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bgyi /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for being called a stream-enterer?

original: yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pa ni /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for a stream-enterer

original: dper na / nya tshag gu zhes bgyi ba dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: dper na / nya tshag gu zhes bgyi ba dang 'dra'o zhes gsungs /
translated: to be said to be like a small fish?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: rgyun du zhugs pas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed bcad mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed bcad mod kyi /
translated: although a stream-enterer has severed countless afflictions,

original: rnam pa 'di gsum lci bas rgyun du zhugs pa thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa bcad pa thams cad rnam pa 'di gsum gyi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gsum lci bas rgyun du zhugs pa thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa bcad pa thams cad rnam pa 'di gsum gyi nang du 'dus so //
translated: because these three aspects are heavy, all the afflictions severed by all stream-enterers are included in these three aspects.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / rgyal po chen po 'chag cing 'gro ba na dmag gi tshogs rnam pa bzhi dang bcas mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po chen po 'chag cing 'gro ba na dmag gi tshogs rnam pa bzhi dang bcas mod kyi /
translated: Great King, when a king goes out for a walk, he is accompanied by the four divisions of his army.

original: 'jig rten pas rgyal po 'ongs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas rgyal po 'ongs so //
translated: But people say, “The king has come!”

original: song ngo // zhes zer ro //
analyzed: song ngo // zhes zer ro //
translated: “The king has gone!”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten na btsun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na btsun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because in the world he is the most honored.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The three types of afflictions are like that.

original: ci'i phyir lci ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lci ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called “heavy”?

original: sems can thams cad kyis rtag tu bskyed pa'i phyir /🔽phra zhing shes par dka' ba'i phyir @362a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis rtag tu bskyed pa'i phyir / phra zhing shes par dka' ba'i phyir @362a *//
translated: Because all sentient beings always give rise to them.

original: lci ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lci ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “heavy” because they are subtle and difficult to know.

original: nyon mongs pa de gsum shin tu gcod dka' ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi gnyen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de gsum shin tu gcod dka' ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ba dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi gnyen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those three afflictions are very difficult to cut off because they become the cause of all afflictions and the cause of the antidotes of morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sems can kha cig ni rgyun du zhugs pas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed yongs su bcad do zhes thos nas phyir ldog pa'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni rgyun du zhugs pas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed yongs su bcad do zhes thos nas phyir ldog pa'i sems skye ste /
translated: Some sentient beings, hearing that the stream-enterer has eliminated immeasurable afflictions, give rise to the thought of turning back.

original: 'di skad du sems can gyis ji ltar nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed gcod nus zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di skad du sems can gyis ji ltar nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed gcod nus zhes zer te /
translated: They say, “How can sentient beings eliminate immeasurable afflictions?”

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas thabs kyis rnam pa gsum du gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas thabs kyis rnam pa gsum du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata taught the three kinds of methods.

original: ji ltar khyod kyis ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pas phyogs bzhir lta ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pas phyogs bzhir lta ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As you asked, “What are the causes and conditions for the stream-enterer to look in the four directions?”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rgyun du zhugs pas bden pa bzhi brtags nas dngos po rnam pa bzhi thob bo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas bden pa bzhi brtags nas dngos po rnam pa bzhi thob bo //
translated: the stream-enterer, having examined the four truths, attains four kinds of things.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?🔽The stable path is the stream-enterer.

original: rab tu brtan pa'i lam la gnas pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba dang / dgra chen po gzhom nus pa'o; ;de la brtan pa'i lam ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu brtan pa'i lam la gnas pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba dang / dgra chen po gzhom nus pa'o; ;de la brtan pa'i lam ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: The stable path is the stream-enterer.

original: dbang po lnga la sus kyang bskyong mi nus pa'i phyir brtan pa'i lam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga la sus kyang bskyong mi nus pa'i phyir brtan pa'i lam la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the five faculties cannot be sustained by anyone, it is called abiding on the path of stability.

original: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad la smod pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi rol gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad la smod pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization means reviling all inner and outer afflictions.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ni bzod pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ni bzod pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Seeing reality as it is is the wisdom of acceptance.

original: dgra chen po gzhom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgra chen po gzhom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The great enemy to be conquered is as follows:

original: phyin ci log @362b bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log @362b bzhi'o //
translated: The four misconceptions.

original: ji ltar khyod kyis ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As you said, What is the cause and what is the condition for being called a stream-enterer?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rgyun du zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Stream is undefiled,

original: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni sgom pa ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni sgom pa ste /
translated: Enterer is cultivation,

original: zag pa med pa sgom pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa sgom pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of cultivating the undefiled, it is called stream-entry.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: yang rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bab ba'o //
analyzed: yang rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bab ba'o //
translated: Moreover, stream-entry is descending,

original: 'bab pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bab pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Descending has two aspects:

original: thur du 'bab pa dang / gyen du 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: thur du 'bab pa dang / gyen du 'bab pa ste /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa de la'ang mdor na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two types of non-returners.

original: da ltar gyi dus su phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu thob nas de bas kyang brtson 'grus su nan tan byas pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la chags nas 'dod pa'i khams su phung po mi len pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu thob nas de bas kyang brtson 'grus su nan tan byas pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la chags nas 'dod pa'i khams su phung po mi len pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having attained the result of non-return in the present time, by being diligent in effort beyond that, one attains the result of arhatship. Or, having become attached to the peaceful samadhis of the form realm and the formless realm, one is called a non-returner because one does not take up the aggregates in the desire realm.

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Again, there are five types of non-returners.

original: bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / lus blangs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / spyod pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / spyod pa med pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / rgyun rabs kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / lus blangs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / spyod pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / spyod pa med pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / rgyun rabs kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: 1. those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, 2. those who attain nirvana after having taken up a body, 3. those who attain nirvana through practice, 4. those who attain nirvana without practice, 5. those who attain nirvana by stages.

original: yang rnam pa drug ste /🔽de ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / lnga ni gong ma dang 'dra'o yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa drug ste / de ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / lnga ni gong ma dang 'dra'o yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are six types:

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / drug ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / drug ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: 1. those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, 2. those who attain nirvana after having taken up a body, 3. those who attain nirvana through practice, 4. those who attain nirvana without practice, 5. those who attain nirvana by stages, 6. those who attain nirvana in the formless realm.

original: spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of those who attain nirvana through practice:

original: skye ba gnyis @365b len pa dang / skye ba bzhi len pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gnyis @365b len pa dang / skye ba bzhi len pa'o //
translated: 1. those who take two births, 2. those who take four births.

original: de la gang skye ba gnyis len pa ni dbang po rno ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang skye ba gnyis len pa ni dbang po rno ba'o //
translated: Those who take two births are of sharp faculties.

original: gang skye ba bzhi len pa ni dbang po rtul ba'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba bzhi len pa ni dbang po rtul ba'o //
translated: Those who take four births are of dull faculties.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types:🔽1. those who go higher, 2. those who go lower.

original: brtson 'grus che zhing dbang gi ting nge 'dzin med pa dang / le lo can dag dbang gi ting nge 'dzin yod pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus che zhing dbang gi ting nge 'dzin med pa dang / le lo can dag dbang gi ting nge 'dzin yod pa'o //
translated: Those of great diligence do not have the samadhi of power, and the lazy do have the samadhi of power.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, there are two kinds:

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa dang / de gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa dang / de gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: those who have the samadhi of diligence and those who do not have either of those.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can rnams la las rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can rnams la las rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Sentient beings of the desire realm and form realm have two kinds of karma:

original: byed pa'i las dang / skye ba len pa'i las so //
analyzed: byed pa'i las dang / skye ba len pa'i las so //
translated: karma of action and karma of taking birth.

original: bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni byed pa'i las 'ba' zhig yod de /
analyzed: bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni byed pa'i las 'ba' zhig yod de /
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state only have karma of action,

original: skye ba len pa'i las med do //
analyzed: skye ba len pa'i las med do //
translated: and they do not have karma of taking birth.

original: de bas na bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “attaining nirvana in the intermediate state.”

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po ni bor /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po ni bor /
translated: The aggregates of the desire realm are cast off,

original: dbang po rno ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po rno ba'i phyir gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: and because the faculties are sharp, they attain nirvana without reaching the form realm.

original: de ni bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: That is attaining nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: phyir mi ldog pa la bsam pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa la bsam pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four kinds of non-returners:

original: slob pa ma yin slob pa med pa ma yin pa dang / slob pa dang / slob pa med pa dang / slob pa med slob pa'ang ma yin par mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: slob pa ma yin slob pa med pa ma yin pa dang / slob pa dang / slob pa med pa dang / slob pa med slob pa'ang ma yin par mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana upon birth, those who attain nirvana with effort, and those who attain nirvana without effort.

original: yang ji ltar na bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba zhe na /
translated: How is it that one attains nirvana in the intermediate state?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems rnam pa bzhi las gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems rnam pa bzhi las gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: from among the four kinds of non-returners, two attain nirvana,

original: gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: and two do not attain nirvana.

original: de bas na bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba @366a *//
analyzed: de bas na bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba @366a *//
translated: Therefore, it is called “attaining nirvana in the intermediate state.”

original: zhes bya'o // phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two kinds of attaining nirvana after taking up a body:

original: byed pa'i las dang / skye ba'i las so //
analyzed: byed pa'i las dang / skye ba'i las so //
translated: the karma of action and the karma of birth.

original: des 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung kho por nas gzugs kyi khams kyi phung po len te /
analyzed: des 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung kho por nas gzugs kyi khams kyi phung po len te /
translated: Having taken up the aggregates of the desire realm, one takes up the aggregates of the form realm.

original: lam la brtson 'grus su nan tan byed pas tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: lam la brtson 'grus su nan tan byed pas tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: He diligently practices the path with perseverance, and when his life ends, he attains nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: gal te tshe'i dus bgyis pa la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: gal te tshe'i dus bgyis pa la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: if the end of life is called nirvana,

original: ci'i slad du phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'da'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i slad du phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'da'o zhes gsungs /
translated: why did you say that one attains nirvana by taking up the aggregates?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: des phung po blangs nas gdod khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa gcod do //
analyzed: des phung po blangs nas gdod khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa gcod do //
translated: after taking up the aggregates, one then cuts off the afflictions of the three realms.

original: de bas na phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phung po blangs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one attains nirvana by taking up the aggregates.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag tu lam la nan tan byed de /
analyzed: spyod pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag tu lam la nan tan byed de /
translated: those who attain nirvana through practice constantly apply themselves to the path.

original: 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod pas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod pas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Through the power of conditioned concentration, they cut off the afflictions and attain nirvana through the practice of nirvana.

original: spyod pa tshad med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni des nges par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar shes nas de'i phyir le lo byed de /
analyzed: spyod pa tshad med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni des nges par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar shes nas de'i phyir le lo byed de /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through immeasurable conduct are those who, knowing that they will definitely attain nirvana, become lazy.

original: des kyang 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des kyang 'dus byas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs kyis tshe'i dus byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: They attain nirvana by dying through the power of conditioned concentration.🔽Therefore, they are called those who attain nirvana through the absence of conduct.

original: de bas na spyod pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes @366b bya'o; ;rgyun rabs kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas bsam gtan dang po la dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: de bas na spyod pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes @366b bya'o; ;rgyun rabs kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas bsam gtan dang po la dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through lineage are those who, having attained the fourth absorption, give rise to a mind that delights in the first absorption.

original: de'i rgyus phyir bsam gtan dang por skye'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyus phyir bsam gtan dang por skye'o //
translated: Through that cause, they are reborn in the first absorption.

original: rgyun la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyun la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Lineage is of two types:

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyun dang / lam gyi rgyun no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyun dang / lam gyi rgyun no //
translated: the lineage of afflictions and the lineage of the path.

original: des lam gyi rgyun gyis tshe'i dus byas nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
analyzed: des lam gyi rgyun gyis tshe'i dus byas nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la dga' ba'i sems skyes te /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through the lineage of the path are those who, having died through the lineage of the path, give rise to a mind that delights in the second absorption.

original: dga' ba'i rkyen gyis bsam gtan gnyis par skye'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rkyen gyis bsam gtan gnyis par skye'o //
translated: The second meditation is born from the condition of joy.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the fourth meditation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa de la'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa de la'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This fourth meditation is of two types:

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro ba dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro ba'o //
translated: that which goes to the formless realm and that which goes to the five pure abodes.

original: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni ting nge 'dzin la dga'/
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni ting nge 'dzin la dga'/
translated: Thus, one of these two is delighted with concentration,

original: gcig ni shes rab la dga'o //
analyzed: gcig ni shes rab la dga'o //
translated: and the other is delighted with wisdom.

original: de la shes rab la dga' ba ni gnas gtsang ma ris lngar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab la dga' ba ni gnas gtsang ma ris lngar 'gro'o //
translated: Among them, the one who is delighted with wisdom goes to the five pure abodes.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro'o //
translated: The one who is delighted with concentration goes to the formless realm.

original: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la khyad par rnam pa lngar sgom mo //
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la khyad par rnam pa lngar sgom mo //
translated: Thus, one of these two cultivates the distinctions in the four meditations in five ways,

original: gcig ni mi sgom mo //
analyzed: gcig ni mi sgom mo //
translated: and the other does not cultivate them.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi'ang rab bo //
analyzed: tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi'ang rab bo //
translated: The lowest, the middling, the highest, the middling of the highest, and the highest of the highest.

original: de la rab kyi'ang rab sgom pa ni 'og min gyi gnam du gnas so //
analyzed: de la rab kyi'ang rab sgom pa ni 'og min gyi gnam du gnas so //
translated: The best of the best meditators dwell in the Akaniṣṭha heaven.

original: rab kyi 'bring sgom pa ni gya nom snang ba gnam du gnas so //🔽rab bsgom pa ni shin tu mthong ba @367a *//
analyzed: rab kyi 'bring sgom pa ni gya nom snang ba gnam du gnas so // rab bsgom pa ni shin tu mthong ba @367a *//
translated: The best of the middling meditators dwell in the heaven of Excellent Vision.

original: gnam du gnas so //
analyzed: gnam du gnas so //
translated: The best meditators dwell in the heaven of Seeing Far.

original: 'bring sgom pa ni mi gdung gnam du gnas so //
analyzed: 'bring sgom pa ni mi gdung gnam du gnas so //
translated: The middling meditators dwell in the heaven of No Torment.

original: tha ma sgom pa ni mi che gnam du gnas so //
analyzed: tha ma sgom pa ni mi che gnam du gnas so //
translated: The least meditators dwell in the heaven of No Greatness.

original: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni smra ba la dga'/
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis kyang gcig ni smra ba la dga'/
translated: Thus, of these two, one delights in speech,

original: gcig ni zhi ba la dga'o //
analyzed: gcig ni zhi ba la dga'o //
translated: and the other delights in peace.

original: de la zhi ba la dga' ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la zhi ba la dga' ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro'o //
translated: Among them, those who delight in peace go to the formless realm.

original: smra ba la dga' ba ni gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar gnas so //
analyzed: smra ba la dga' ba ni gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar gnas so //
translated: Those who delight in speech dwell in the five pure abodes.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two types:

original: 'dris pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa dang / 'dris pa mi sgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa dang / 'dris pa mi sgom pa'o //
translated: those who cultivate familiar meditative concentration and those who do not cultivate familiarity.

original: de la 'dris pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa ni gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro'o //
analyzed: de la 'dris pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa ni gnas gtsang ma'i ris lngar 'gro'o //
translated: Among them, those who cultivate familiar meditative concentration go to the five pure abodes.

original: 'dris pa mi sgom pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ste /
analyzed: 'dris pa mi sgom pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ste /
translated: Those who do not cultivate familiarity are born in the formless realm.

original: tshe'i dus byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: tshe'i dus byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: After the end of his life, he will enter parinirvāṇa.

original: de ni rgyun rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyun rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “parinirvāṇa through the constant flow.”

original: gang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro 'dod pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / khyad par lnga sgom mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro 'dod pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / khyad par lnga sgom mi nus so //
translated: Those who wish to go to the formless realm are unable to cultivate the four dhyānas and the five special ones.

original: gang bsam gtan bzhi dang / khyad par lnga sgom pa ni gzugs med pa'i bsam gtan la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gang bsam gtan bzhi dang / khyad par lnga sgom pa ni gzugs med pa'i bsam gtan la mi spyod do //
translated: Those who cultivate the four dhyānas and the five special ones do not practice the formless dhyānas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: bar du mya ngan las 'das pa de dbang po rnon po lags sam /
analyzed: bar du mya ngan las 'das pa de dbang po rnon po lags sam /
translated: is this intermediate parinirvāṇa for those with sharp faculties?

original: gal te dbang po rnon po lags na ci'i slad du da ltar gyi dus su mya ngan las mi 'da'/
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnon po lags na ci'i slad du da ltar gyi dus su mya ngan las mi 'da'/
translated: If it is for those with sharp faculties, why do they not enter parinirvāṇa in the present?

original: ci'i slad du 'dod pa'i khams na bar gyi mya ngan las 'das pa mchis la /
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'dod pa'i khams na bar gyi mya ngan las 'das pa mchis la /
translated: Why is there intermediate parinirvāṇa in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams @367b na ma mchis /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams @367b na ma mchis /
translated: but not in the form realm?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: de ni da ltar gyi dus na chen po ba zhi zhen pas lam sgom mi nus te /
analyzed: de ni da ltar gyi dus na chen po ba zhi zhen pas lam sgom mi nus te /
translated: Now, in this present time, the old man is unable to cultivate the path.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus!

original: chen po bzhi de yang gnas khang dang / bsod snyoms dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs pa yo byad rnams dang mi ldan na /
analyzed: chen po bzhi de yang gnas khang dang / bsod snyoms dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs pa yo byad rnams dang mi ldan na /
translated: If the four old men do not have a dwelling place, alms, robes, bedding, medicine, and other necessities,

original: de ltar gyi dus su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyi dus su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time they will not attain nirvāṇa.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: ngas sngon dus gcig na yul mnyan du yod par gzhal med khang aan gyi der bzhugs pa las /
analyzed: ngas sngon dus gcig na yul mnyan du yod par gzhal med khang aan gyi der bzhugs pa las /
translated: Once, in a past time, I was dwelling in the immeasurable palace in the city of Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong gcig nga gang na ba der 'ongs nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong gcig nga gang na ba der 'ongs nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: A bhikṣu came to where I was and said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‘Bhagavān!

original: bdag gis rtag tu lam bsgoms kyang rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob par ma gyur to //
analyzed: bdag gis rtag tu lam bsgoms kyang rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob par ma gyur to //
translated: Although I have always cultivated the path, I have not attained the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship.’

original: ngas de'i tshe dga' bo la khyod kyis dge slong 'di'i dgos pa thams cad sbyor cig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe dga' bo la khyod kyis dge slong 'di'i dgos pa thams cad sbyor cig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: At that time, I said to Ānanda, ‘You should provide all the necessities for this bhikṣu.’

original: de nas dga' bos dge slong de khrid de /
analyzed: de nas dga' bos dge slong de khrid de /
translated: Then Nanda took the monk and

original: skyabs med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra bar song nas gnas khang bzang po byin no //
analyzed: skyabs med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra bar song nas gnas khang bzang po byin no //
translated: went to the garden of Anāthapiṇḍada. He gave him a good room.

original: de nas dge slong des dga' bo la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas dge slong des dga' bo la smras pa /
translated: Then the monk said to Nanda,

original: btsun pa / bdag gi phyir gnas khang yongs su dag par byas te /
analyzed: btsun pa / bdag gi phyir gnas khang yongs su dag par byas te /
translated: “Noble one, please make my room pure

original: rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan cing dar gyi cod pan dang / ba dan dang / gdugs la sogs pas brgyan du gsol /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan cing dar gyi cod pan dang / ba dan dang / gdugs la sogs pas brgyan du gsol /
translated: and adorn it with the seven precious substances, with silk tassels, banners, parasols, and so forth.”

original: dga' bos smras pa /
analyzed: dga' bos smras pa /
translated: Nanda said,

original: 'jig rten na dbul ba ni dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dbul ba ni dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
translated: “In the world, the poor are called ‘mendicants.’

original: bdag @368a *// gis de dag ga la 'byor /
analyzed: bdag @368a *// gis de dag ga la 'byor /
translated: How can I afford those?”

original: dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des smras pa /
translated: The monk said,

original: btsun pa / gal te bdag gi phyir de dag sbyar na legs so //
analyzed: btsun pa / gal te bdag gi phyir de dag sbyar na legs so //
translated: “Noble one, if you can provide those, that would be good.

original: gal te mi sbyor na bdag slar bcom ldan 'das gang na bar mchi'o //
analyzed: gal te mi sbyor na bdag slar bcom ldan 'das gang na bar mchi'o //
translated: If you cannot, I will return to where the Blessed One is.”

original: de nas dga' bo bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas dga' bo bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Nanda went to where the Blessed One was and said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dge slong de bdag la rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyan dang / cod pan dang / ba dan dang / gdugs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'tshal lo zhes mchi na /
analyzed: dge slong de bdag la rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyan dang / cod pan dang / ba dan dang / gdugs la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'tshal lo zhes mchi na /
translated: The monk said to me, ‘I need various things, such as ornaments of the seven precious materials, a crown, a banner, and a parasol.’

original: bdag gis ji lta bur bgyi zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bdag gis ji lta bur bgyi zhes gsol to //
translated: I asked him, ‘What should I do?’

original: ngas de'i tshe yang dga' bo khyod song la dge slong de'i yid bzhin du dgos pa'i yo byad thams cad sbyor cig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe yang dga' bo khyod song la dge slong de'i yid bzhin du dgos pa'i yo byad thams cad sbyor cig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: I then told Nanda, ‘You should go and provide the monk with all the necessary things according to his wishes.’

original: de nas dga' bos phyir song nas dge slong de'i phyir yo byad thams cad chog par sbyar to //
analyzed: de nas dga' bos phyir song nas dge slong de'i phyir yo byad thams cad chog par sbyar to //
translated: Nanda then went back and provided all the necessary things for the monk.

original: dge slong des thob nas rtse gcig tu bsgoms nas rin po ma thogs par rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob par gyur to //
analyzed: dge slong des thob nas rtse gcig tu bsgoms nas rin po ma thogs par rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob par gyur to //
translated: After the monk received them, he single-mindedly practiced meditation and attained the fruit of stream-entry up to the fruit of arhatship.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of good family!

original: sems can tshad med pa snyed yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rigs pa las phongs brel bas sems 'khrugs pa'i phyir thob par ma gyur to //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa snyed yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rigs pa las phongs brel bas sems 'khrugs pa'i phyir thob par ma gyur to //
translated: Because of the confusion of their minds, which are preoccupied with the affairs of countless sentient beings, they have not attained nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang sems can dag phan pa'i don mang po byed pa la dga' bas brel te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can dag phan pa'i don mang po byed pa la dga' bas brel te /
translated: furthermore, there are sentient beings who are preoccupied with delighting in performing many beneficial actions.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob par ma gyur bas da ltar @368b mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob par ma gyur bas da ltar @368b mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur to //
translated: Because they have not attained meditative absorption, they have not attained nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ji ltar khyod kyi 'di skad du ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po spangs nas bar du mya ngan las 'das pa yod la /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyi 'di skad du ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po spangs nas bar du mya ngan las 'das pa yod la /
translated: as you have asked, “What are the causes and conditions for the existence of nirvana in the middle, after abandoning the aggregates of the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams na med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na med ces bya ba ni /
translated: but not in the form realm?”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang zag des 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rtog pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang zag des 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rtog pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: the person has two kinds of causes and conditions for the afflictions of the desire realm:

original: nang dang / phyi rol lo //
analyzed: nang dang / phyi rol lo //
translated: internal and external.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams na phyi rol gyi rgyu dang rkyen med do //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams na phyi rol gyi rgyu dang rkyen med do //
translated: In the form realm, there are no external causes and conditions.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na sred pa'i sems rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na sred pa'i sems rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In the desire realm, there are two types of craving in the mind:

original: 'dod pa la sred pa dang / gzugs la sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sred pa dang / gzugs la sred pa'o //
translated: craving for desire and craving for form.

original: sred pa de gnyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: sred pa de gnyis rtogs nas /
translated: Having realized these two cravings,

original: sems rtse gcig tu smod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu smod par 'gyur te /
translated: one should single-mindedly despise them.

original: de ltar smad nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar smad nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having despised them in this way, one will attain parinirvāṇa.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na nyon mongs pa sbom po rnams smod par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na nyon mongs pa sbom po rnams smod par byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Despising the coarse afflictions in the desire realm is as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / khrel ba med pa dang / 'dzem pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / khrel ba med pa dang / 'dzem pa med pa ste /
translated: desire, anger, shamelessness, and lack of embarrassment.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to that cause and that condition, one will attain nirvāṇa.

original: yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi lam gyi rang bzhin ni dpa' ba ste /
analyzed: yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi lam gyi rang bzhin ni dpa' ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the nature of the path in the desire realm is heroic.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu bzhi thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it attains the four fruits.

original: de bas na 'dod pa'i khams na bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba yod la /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa'i khams na bar du mya ngan las 'da' ba yod la /
translated: Therefore, there is intermediate parinirvāṇa in the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams na med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na med do //
translated: but not in the form realm.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: bar du mya ngan las 'das pa la mdo rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bar du mya ngan las 'das pa la mdo rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of nirvana in the middle:

original: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'o //🔽de la rab ni phung po spangs nas 'dod @369a *//
analyzed: rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'o // de la rab ni phung po spangs nas 'dod @369a *//
translated: superior, middling, and inferior.

original: pa'i khams dang ma bral bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //🔽'bring ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bral ma thag la /
analyzed: pa'i khams dang ma bral bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o // 'bring ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bral ma thag la /
translated: The superior type is one who attains nirvana without separating from the desire realm after abandoning the aggregates.🔽The middling type is one who attains nirvana immediately after separating from the desire realm

original: gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //🔽tha ma 'dod pa'i khams dang bral nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su ma phyin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o // tha ma 'dod pa'i khams dang bral nas /
translated: but before reaching the form realm.🔽The inferior type is one who attains nirvana after separating from the desire realm

original: gzugs kyi khams la bsnyen nas gdod mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la bsnyen nas gdod mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: and approaching the form realm.

original: dper na / nya tshag gu zas thob nas sdod pa ltar gang zag de'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / nya tshag gu zas thob nas sdod pa ltar gang zag de'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, just as a fish obtains food and stays put, so too is that person.

original: ji ltar na sdod pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdod pa zhe na /
translated: How does one stay put?

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su phung po blangs nas gnas pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su phung po blangs nas gnas pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
translated: Because one takes up the aggregates in the form realm and the formless realm and stays there, it is called “staying put.”

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi lus mi len pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi lus mi len pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called “abiding” because it does not take on the bodies of the gods, humans, hell beings, animals, or hungry ghosts of the desire realm.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed yongs su bcad nas lhag ma cung zad lus pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa snyed yongs su bcad nas lhag ma cung zad lus pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “abiding” because it has cut through immeasurable afflictions and only a little remains.

original: gzhan yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis sdod pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis sdod pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “For what causes and conditions is it called ‘abiding’?”

original: bus pa ma rabs dang mthun pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs dang mthun pa'i las mi byed pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called “abiding” because it does not engage in the actions of childish people.

original: bdag 'jigs pa med pas gzhan 'jigs par mi byed pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag 'jigs pa med pas gzhan 'jigs par mi byed pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called “abiding” because it does not frighten others, as it is itself without fear.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis kyi sred pa spong pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis kyi sred pa spong pa'i phyir sdod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “abiding” because it abandons the craving of both attachment and anger.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi @369b dpe ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi @369b dpe ste /
translated: The other shore is a metaphor for the arhat, the pratyekabuddha, the bodhisattva, and the Buddha.

original: ji ltar rus sbal chu dang skam sa gnyis kar 'gro nus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rus sbal chu dang skam sa gnyis kar 'gro nus pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a tortoise that can move both in the water and on land.

original: de'ang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rus sbal las dpe len zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis rus sbal las dpe len zhe na /
translated: Why is the tortoise used as a metaphor?

original: des yan lag lnga shin tu sbed nus pa'i phyir te; dgra bcom pa nas sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar du'ang de dang 'dra bar dbang po lnga rab tu sbed nus pa'i phyir rus sbal las dpe blangs pa yin no //🔽chu dang skam sa zhes bya ba chu ni 'jig rten gyi dpe'o //
analyzed: des yan lag lnga shin tu sbed nus pa'i phyir te; dgra bcom pa nas sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar du'ang de dang 'dra bar dbang po lnga rab tu sbed nus pa'i phyir rus sbal las dpe blangs pa yin no // chu dang skam sa zhes bya ba chu ni 'jig rten gyi dpe'o //
translated: Because it can hide its five limbs well. In the same way, from the arhat up to the Buddha, the five faculties are well hidden.

original: skam sa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: skam sa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa lta bu ste /
translated: “Water” and “land” are metaphors for the mundane and the supramundane.

original: 'phags pa de dag kyang de dang 'dra bar sdig pa mi dge ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad shin tu rtogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir chu dang skam sa gnyis ka la 'gro nus pa las dper blangs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag kyang de dang 'dra bar sdig pa mi dge ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad shin tu rtogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir chu dang skam sa gnyis ka la 'gro nus pa las dper blangs so //
translated: The noble ones are like this. After thoroughly understanding all the afflictions of evil and nonvirtue, they are able to go to the other shore. They are able to go on both land and water.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: ji ltar klung gangg'a'i nang na sems can rnam pa bdun yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar klung gangg'a'i nang na sems can rnam pa bdun yod de /
translated: In the Ganges there are seven kinds of beings.

original: nya dang rus sbal zhes ming so sor btags pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nya dang rus sbal zhes ming so sor btags pa yod mod kyi /
translated: They are called by different names, such as fish and turtles.

original: chu las gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chu las gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: But they are not other than water.

original: de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dam pa chen po'i nang na'ang log sred can nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dam pa chen po'i nang na'ang log sred can nas /
translated: In the same way, in the great, supreme nirvana, there are those with wrong desires,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar du ming so sor btags pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bar du ming so sor btags pa yod mod kyi /
translated: up to the buddhas, who are called by different names.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni chu las gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni chu las gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: But buddha-nature is not other than water.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽sems can rnam pa bdun po de dag gi dge ba'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / sems can rnam pa bdun po de dag gi dge ba'am /
translated: Son of good family!🔽Those seven kinds of beings,

original: mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am /
translated: whether virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: thabs kyi lam mam /
analyzed: thabs kyi lam mam /
translated: whether on the path of means or

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam mam /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam mam /
translated: the path of liberation,

original: rim gyis 'jug pa'i lam mam /
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug pa'i lam mam /
translated: the path of gradual entry,

original: rgyu'am / 'bras bu'am /🔽thams cad kyang sangs rgyas @370a *//
analyzed: rgyu'am / 'bras bu'am / thams cad kyang sangs rgyas @370a *//
translated: or cause or effect,

original: kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: all of them are the nature of the Buddha.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gi yid dang sbyar te gsungs pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gi yid dang sbyar te gsungs pa'i tshig go /
translated: This is the word of the Tathāgata, which accords with my mind.🔽The bodhisattva Kāśyapa said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: ji tsam du rgyu mchis na 'bras bu'ang mchis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji tsam du rgyu mchis na 'bras bu'ang mchis par 'gyur te /
translated: to the extent that there is a cause, there is also an effect.

original: gal te rgyu ma mchis na 'bras bu'ang ma mchis so //
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma mchis na 'bras bu'ang ma mchis so //
translated: If there were no cause, there would be no effect.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'bras bu zhes bgyi ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'bras bu zhes bgyi ste /
translated: Nirvāṇa is called an effect,

original: rtag pa'i slad du rgyu ma mchis so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i slad du rgyu ma mchis so //
translated: but because it is permanent, it has no cause.

original: gal te rgyu ma mchis na ji ltar 'bras bu zhes bgyi /
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma mchis na ji ltar 'bras bu zhes bgyi /
translated: If it has no cause, how can it be called an effect?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de nyid dge sbyong zhes bgyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de nyid dge sbyong zhes bgyi /
translated: That nirvāṇa itself is called a śramaṇa,

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes kyang bgyi na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes kyang bgyi na /
translated: and it is also called the effect of a śramaṇa.

original: dge sbyong zhes bgyi ba ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: dge sbyong zhes bgyi ba ni ji lta bu /
translated: What is a śramaṇa like?

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu i gnag lags //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu i gnag lags //
translated: What is the effect of a śramaṇa?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: 'jig rten thams cad na 'bras bu rnam pa bdun yod do; ;gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad na 'bras bu rnam pa bdun yod do; ;gang zhe na /
translated: In the world, there are seven types of effects:

original: thabs kyi 'bras bu dang / drin la lan glan pa'i 'bras bu dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / lhag ma'i 'bras bu dang / mnyam pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / spong pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi 'bras bu dang / drin la lan glan pa'i 'bras bu dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / lhag ma'i 'bras bu dang / mnyam pa'i 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / spong pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the effect of efficacy, the effect of human action, the effect of dominance, the effect of natural out­flow, the effect of virile activity, the effect of retribution, and the effect of disconnection.🔽The effect of efficacy is like the effect of the seed, etc.

original: de la thabs kyi 'bras bu ni ji ltar 'jig rten pas ston khre 'bras mang du 'dus pas gcig la gcig thabs kyi 'bras bu rnyed par gyur to zhes smra ste /
analyzed: de la thabs kyi 'bras bu ni ji ltar 'jig rten pas ston khre 'bras mang du 'dus pas gcig la gcig thabs kyi 'bras bu rnyed par gyur to zhes smra ste /
translated: The effect of human action is like the effect of the artisan, etc.🔽The effect of dominance is like the effect of the king, etc.🔽The effect of natural outflow is like the effect of the cause of the same stage.🔽The effect of virile activity is like the effect of the dominant condition, etc.

original: thabs kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba nyid las byas pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba nyid las byas pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The effect of retribution is like the effect of the retributive cause.🔽The effect of disconnection is like the effect of the path of abandonment.

original: 'bras bu de la rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu de la rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause is twofold:

original: nye ba'i rgyu dang / ring ba'i @370b rgyu'o //🔽de la nye ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de 'di skad du bdag gis bsnyen bkur byas pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhes smra ba ste /

analyzed: 'bras bu de la'ang rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: de ni lhag ma'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: de la nye ba'i rgyu ni 'di ltar sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las spyod pa'o //

analyzed: 'bras bu de la'ang rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: zhi ba'i dben pa la dga' ba thob pa'i phyir dge sbyong zhes bya'o //

analyzed: lam de'ang de dang 'dra bar mi'i nang na tha ma dag mi'i rab tu 'gyur bar byed pas dge sbyong zhes bya'o //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa'ang lam de bsgoms na dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu @372b zhes bya ba ni slob pa med pa ste /

original: chos kyi sku'i yan lag lnga'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i yan lag lnga'o //

analyzed: yan lag lnga po de'i rkyen gyis pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur te /

original: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called pāramitā.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir 'di skad du bdag ni skye ba zad do //
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir 'di skad du bdag ni skye ba zad do //

analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rdzogs so //

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //

original: srid pa phyi ma mi len no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: srid pa phyi ma mi len no zhes smra'o //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

analyzed: dgra bcom pa des dus gsum gyi skye ba'i rgyu yongs su bcad pa'i phyir 'di skad du bdag skye ba zad do zhes smra'o //
translated: because the arhat has severed the causes of birth in the three times, he says, ‘I have exhausted birth.’

analyzed: khams gsum gyi lnga phung gi lus bcad pa'i phyir bdag skye ba zad do zhes smra'o //

analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa mthar thug pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa rdzogs so zhes zer ro //

analyzed: slob pa'i lam spong ba'i phyir yang tshangs par spyod pa rdzogs so zhes smra'o //

analyzed: ji ltar thog ma 'tshol ba'i rnam pa de thob pa'i phyir bya ba byas so zhes smra'o //

analyzed: lam bsgoms nas 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir yang bya ba byas so zhes smra'o //

translated: Because he has attained the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising, he says, I have completely purified all the defilements of existence.

original: de bas dgra bcom pa dag pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas dgra bcom pa dag pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Arhats are called those who have gone to the other shore.

original: dgra bcom pa ji lta ba de ltar rang sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin no //
